Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Fix the variable scope issue and properly filter the Scientific Reports 2012 articles print("Loading and filtering Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {target_file}") print(f"Search timestamp: {search_data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total queries executed: {search_data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total results found: {search_data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}") # Extract the detailed results which should contain the article data detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nüìä DETAILED RESULTS ANALYSIS:") print(f"Number of result sets: {len(detailed_results)}") # Collect all articles from all search result sets all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f"\n Result Set {i}: {len(results)} articles") print(f" Query: {query}") # Add articles to our collection with context for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") print("=" * 80) # Now filter for target articles (2012 Scientific Reports with nano-compounds, no plasmons) print(f"\nüîç FILTERING FOR TARGET ARTICLES:") print("Criteria: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text for analysis (fix variable scope issue) combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" # Check filtering criteria is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text is_scientific_reports = ( 'scientific reports' in combined_text or 'sci rep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/srep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/articles/srep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/subjects' in combined_text ) # Check for nano-compound terms nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] has_nano_compound = any(term in combined_text for term in nano_terms) # Check for plasmon terms (we want articles WITHOUT these) plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] has_plasmon = any(term in combined_text for term in plasmon_terms) # Apply filtering criteria meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: # Find which nano terms matched matching_nano_terms = [term for term in nano_terms if term in combined_text] target_articles.append({ 'article_id': len(target_articles) + 1, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source_query': article.get('source_query', ''), 'result_set': article.get('result_set', 0), 'matching_nano_terms': matching_nano_terms, 'criteria_met': { '2012': is_2012, 'scientific_reports': is_scientific_reports, 'nano_compound': has_nano_compound, 'no_plasmon': not has_plasmon } }) print(f"‚úÖ Article {len(target_articles)}: {title[:60]}...") print(f" Nano terms found: {', '.join(matching_nano_terms)}") print(f" URL: {link}") print() print(f"\nüéØ FILTERING RESULTS:") print(f"Total articles processed: {len(all_articles)}") print(f"Target articles identified: {len(target_articles)}") if len(target_articles) == 0: print("\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles met all criteria. Let's analyze why...") # Diagnostic analysis has_2012 = sum(1 for a in all_articles if '2012' in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}") has_sci_rep = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in ['scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep'])) has_nano = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in nano_terms)) has_plasmons = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in plasmon_terms)) print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {has_2012}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {has_sci_rep}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {has_nano}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {has_plasmons}") # Show some sample articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i, article in enumerate(all_articles[:3], 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') combined = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Has 2012: {'2012' in combined}") print(f" Has Sci Rep: {any(term in combined for term in ['scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep'])}") print(f" Has Nano: {any(term in combined for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" Has Plasmon: {any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms)}") elif len(target_articles) < 23: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(target_articles)} articles, but PLAN mentions 23 target articles.") print(f"This might be due to strict filtering criteria or the search results may not contain all 23.") # Save the filtered results regardless of count timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") target_file_output = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content': 'nano-compounds', 'exclusion': 'no plasmon mentions' }, 'nano_terms_searched': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms_excluded': plasmon_terms, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(target_file_output, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Filtered results saved to: {target_file_output}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã TARGET ARTICLES SUMMARY:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds studied") else: print(f"\nüîÑ NEXT STEP: Review filtering criteria or search for additional article sources") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")

Execution failed - NameError on line 76 due to undefined variable 'combined_text' in the generator expression for checking nano-compound terms. The code successfully loaded the search results JSON file containing 139 articles from 10 search queries and began the filtering process. It properly identified the data structure and started collecting articles, but crashed when trying to filter for nano-compound terms because 'combined_text' was referenced before being defined in the loop scope. **PLAN** alignment: 65% - data loaded and initial processing completed, but filtering incomplete due to variable scope error. Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Fix the variable scope issue and properly filter the Scientific Reports 2012 articles print("Loading and filtering Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {target_file}") print(f"Search timestamp: {search_data.get('search_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total queries executed: {search_data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total results found: {search_data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}") # Extract the detailed results which should contain the article data detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nüìä DETAILED RESULTS ANALYSIS:") print(f"Number of result sets: {len(detailed_results)}") # Collect all articles from all search result sets all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f"\n Result Set {i}: {len(results)} articles") print(f" Query: {query}") # Add articles to our collection with context for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") print("=" * 80) # Now filter for target articles (2012 Scientific Reports with nano-compounds, no plasmons) print(f"\nüîç FILTERING FOR TARGET ARTICLES:") print("Criteria: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text for analysis (fix variable scope issue) combined_text = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" # Check filtering criteria is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text is_scientific_reports = ( 'scientific reports' in combined_text or 'sci rep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/srep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/articles/srep' in combined_text or 'nature.com/subjects' in combined_text ) # Check for nano-compound terms nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] has_nano_compound = any(term in combined_text for term in nano_terms) # Check for plasmon terms (we want articles WITHOUT these) plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] has_plasmon = any(term in combined_text for term in plasmon_terms) # Apply filtering criteria meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: # Let's analyze why...") # Diagnostic analysis has_2012 = sum(1 for a in all_articles if '2012' in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}") has_sci_rep = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in ['scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep'])) has_nano = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in nano_terms)) has_plasmons = sum(1 for a in all_articles if any(term in f"{a.get('title', '').lower()} {a.get('snippet', '').lower()} {a.get('link', '').lower()}" for term in plasmon_terms)) print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {has_2012}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {has_sci_rep}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {has_nano}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {has_plasmons}") # Show some sample articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i, article in enumerate(all_articles[:3], 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') combined = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Has 2012: {'2012' in combined}") print(f" Has Sci Rep: {any(term in combined for term in ['scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep'])}") print(f" Has Nano: {any(term in combined for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" Has Plasmon: {any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms)}") elif len(target_articles) < 23: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(target_articles)} articles, but PLAN mentions 23 target articles.") print(f"This might be due to strict filtering criteria or the search results may not contain all 23.") # Save the filtered results regardless of count timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") target_file_output = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content': 'nano-compounds', 'exclusion': 'no plasmon mentions' }, 'nano_terms_searched': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms_excluded': plasmon_terms, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(target_file_output, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Filtered results saved to: {target_file_output}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã TARGET ARTICLES SUMMARY:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds studied") else: print(f"\nüîÑ NEXT STEP: Review filtering criteria or search for additional article sources") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the JSON file structure before processing print("Inspecting Scientific Reports 2012 search results structure...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): # First inspection - understand the file structure with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {os.path.basename(target_file)}") print(f"File type: {type(search_data)}") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Examine each top-level key for key, value in search_data.items(): print(f"\n Key '{key}': {type(value)}") if isinstance(value, list): print(f" List length: {len(value)}") if len(value) > 0: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") elif isinstance(value, str): print(f" String value: {value[:100]}...") elif isinstance(value, (int, float)): print(f" Numeric value: {value}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DETAILED RESULTS STRUCTURE ANALYSIS") print("=" * 80) # Focus on detailed_results which should contain the articles detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nDetailed results structure:") print(f"Number of result sets: {len(detailed_results)}") if detailed_results: sample_result_set = detailed_results[0] print(f"\nSample result set structure:") print(f"Keys: {list(sample_result_set.keys())}") # Examine the 'results' within each result set if 'results' in sample_result_set: articles = sample_result_set['results'] print(f"\nArticles in first result set: {len(articles)}") if articles: sample_article = articles[0] print(f"\nSample article structure:") print(f"Keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") # Show sample values for key fields for key, value in sample_article.items(): if isinstance(value, str): preview = value.replace('\n', ' ').replace('\t', ' ')[:150] print(f" {key}: {preview}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("ARTICLE COLLECTION AND FILTERING") print("=" * 80) # Now collect all articles with proper variable scoping all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f"\nResult Set {i}: {len(results)} articles") print(f"Query: {query}") # Add articles to collection with context for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") # Define filtering terms outside the loop to avoid scope issues nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] scientific_reports_terms = [ 'scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep', 'nature.com/articles/srep', 'nature.com/subjects' ] print(f"\nüîç APPLYING FILTERING CRITERIA:") print(f"Nano terms: {nano_terms[:5]}... (total: {len(nano_terms)})") print(f"Plasmon terms (excluded): {plasmon_terms}") print(f"Scientific Reports indicators: {scientific_reports_terms[:3]}...") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text for analysis (proper variable scoping) title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() link_lower = link.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower} {link_lower}" # Apply filtering criteria step by step is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text is_scientific_reports = any(term in combined_text for term in scientific_reports_terms) has_nano_compound = any(term in combined_text for term in nano_terms) has_plasmon = any(term in combined_text for term in plasmon_terms) # Find matching nano terms for this article matching_nano_terms = [term for term in nano_terms if term in combined_text] # Article meets criteria if: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: target_articles.append({ 'article_id': len(target_articles) + 1, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source_query': article.get('source_query', ''), 'result_set': article.get('result_set', 0), 'matching_nano_terms': matching_nano_terms, 'criteria_analysis': { '2012': is_2012, 'scientific_reports': is_scientific_reports, 'nano_compound': has_nano_compound, 'no_plasmon': not has_plasmon } }) print(f"‚úÖ Target Article {len(target_articles)}:") print(f" Title: {title[:70]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(matching_nano_terms)}") print(f" URL: {link}") print() print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"FILTERING RESULTS SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"Total articles processed: {len(all_articles)}") print(f"Target articles identified: {len(target_articles)}") # Diagnostic analysis if no articles found if len(target_articles) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles met all criteria. Diagnostic analysis:") # Count articles meeting individual criteria count_2012 = 0 count_sci_rep = 0 count_nano = 0 count_plasmon = 0 for article in all_articles: title = article.get('title', '').lower() snippet = article.get('snippet', '').lower() link = article.get('link', '').lower() combined = f"{title} {snippet} {link}" if '2012' in combined: count_2012 += 1 if any(term in combined for term in scientific_reports_terms): count_sci_rep += 1 if any(term in combined for term in nano_terms): count_nano += 1 if any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms): count_plasmon += 1 print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {count_2012}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {count_sci_rep}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {count_nano}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {count_plasmon}/{len(all_articles)}") # Show first 3 articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i in range(min(3, len(all_articles))): article = all_articles[i] title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') combined = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" ‚úì 2012: {'2012' in combined}") print(f" ‚úì Sci Rep: {any(term in combined for term in scientific_reports_terms)}") print(f" ‚úì Nano: {any(term in combined for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" ‚ùå Plasmon: {any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms)}") # Save results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") output_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_target_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': os.path.basename(target_file), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content_required': 'nano-compounds', 'content_excluded': 'plasmon mentions' }, 'search_terms': { 'nano_terms': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms': plasmon_terms, 'journal_indicators': scientific_reports_terms }, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(output_file)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã IDENTIFIED TARGET ARTICLES:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds") else: print(f"\nüîÑ RECOMMENDATION: Adjust filtering criteria or search additional sources") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 122 due to undefined variable 'combined_text' in the generator expression within the filtering loop. The code successfully loaded the search results JSON file (151KB) containing 139 articles from 10 search queries and properly analyzed the data structure. It identified detailed results from multiple search queries and began collecting articles with context, but crashed when applying the filtering criteria because 'combined_text' was referenced in a generator expression before being defined in the loop scope. **PLAN** alignment: 70% - data loaded, structure analyzed, and article collection completed, but filtering incomplete due to the variable scope error. Recommended fix: Move the 'combined_text' variable definition (line 54) before any generator expressions that use it, specifically before the 'has_nano_compound = any(term in combined_text for term in nano_terms)' line. The foundation is excellent with 139 articles collected and comprehensive filtering logic in place - just needs the scope issue resolved to complete the identification of target Scientific Reports 2012 nano-compound articles.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the JSON file structure before processing print("Inspecting Scientific Reports 2012 search results structure...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): # First inspection - understand the file structure with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {os.path.basename(target_file)}") print(f"File type: {type(search_data)}") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(search_data.keys())}") # Examine each top-level key for key, value in search_data.items(): print(f"\n Key '{key}': {type(value)}") if isinstance(value, list): print(f" List length: {len(value)}") if len(value) > 0: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") elif isinstance(value, str): print(f" String value: {value[:100]}...") elif isinstance(value, (int, float)): print(f" Numeric value: {value}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DETAILED RESULTS STRUCTURE ANALYSIS") print("=" * 80) # Focus on detailed_results which should contain the articles detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nDetailed results structure:") print(f"Number of result sets: {len(detailed_results)}") if detailed_results: sample_result_set = detailed_results[0] print(f"\nSample result set structure:") print(f"Keys: {list(sample_result_set.keys())}") # Examine the 'results' within each result set if 'results' in sample_result_set: articles = sample_result_set['results'] print(f"\nArticles in first result set: {len(articles)}") if articles: sample_article = articles[0] print(f"\nSample article structure:") print(f"Keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") # Show sample values for key fields for key, value in sample_article.items(): if isinstance(value, str): preview = value.replace('\n', ' ').replace('\t', ' ')[:150] print(f" {key}: {preview}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("ARTICLE COLLECTION AND FILTERING") print("=" * 80) # Now collect all articles with proper variable scoping all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f"\nResult Set {i}: {len(results)} articles") print(f"Query: {query}") # Add articles to collection with context for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") # Define filtering terms outside the loop to avoid scope issues nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] scientific_reports_terms = [ 'scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep', 'nature.com/articles/srep', 'nature.com/subjects' ] print(f"\nüîç APPLYING FILTERING CRITERIA:") print(f"Nano terms: {nano_terms[:5]}... (total: {len(nano_terms)})") print(f"Plasmon terms (excluded): {plasmon_terms}") print(f"Scientific Reports indicators: {scientific_reports_terms[:3]}...") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text for analysis (proper variable scoping) title_lower = title.lower() snippet_lower = snippet.lower() link_lower = link.lower() combined_text = f"{title_lower} {snippet_lower} {link_lower}" # Apply filtering criteria step by step is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text is_scientific_reports = any(term in combined_text for term in scientific_reports_terms) has_nano_compound = any(term in combined_text for term in nano_terms) has_plasmon = any(term in combined_text for term in plasmon_terms) # Find matching nano terms for this article matching_nano_terms = [term for term in nano_terms if term in combined_text] # Article meets criteria if: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: target_articles.append({ 'article_id': len(target_articles) + 1, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source_query': article.get('source_query', ''), 'result_set': article.get('result_set', 0), 'matching_nano_terms': matching_nano_terms, 'criteria_analysis': { '2012': is_2012, 'scientific_reports': is_scientific_reports, 'nano_compound': has_nano_compound, 'no_plasmon': not has_plasmon } }) print(f"‚úÖ Target Article {len(target_articles)}:") print(f" Title: {title[:70]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(matching_nano_terms)}") print(f" URL: {link}") print() print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"FILTERING RESULTS SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"Total articles processed: {len(all_articles)}") print(f"Target articles identified: {len(target_articles)}") # Diagnostic analysis if no articles found if len(target_articles) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles met all criteria. Diagnostic analysis:") # Count articles meeting individual criteria count_2012 = 0 count_sci_rep = 0 count_nano = 0 count_plasmon = 0 for article in all_articles: title = article.get('title', '').lower() snippet = article.get('snippet', '').lower() link = article.get('link', '').lower() combined = f"{title} {snippet} {link}" if '2012' in combined: count_2012 += 1 if any(term in combined for term in scientific_reports_terms): count_sci_rep += 1 if any(term in combined for term in nano_terms): count_nano += 1 if any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms): count_plasmon += 1 print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {count_2012}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {count_sci_rep}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {count_nano}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {count_plasmon}/{len(all_articles)}") # Show first 3 articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i in range(min(3, len(all_articles))): article = all_articles[i] title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') combined = f"{title.lower()} {snippet.lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" ‚úì 2012: {'2012' in combined}") print(f" ‚úì Sci Rep: {any(term in combined for term in scientific_reports_terms)}") print(f" ‚úì Nano: {any(term in combined for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" ‚ùå Plasmon: {any(term in combined for term in plasmon_terms)}") # Save results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") output_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_target_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': os.path.basename(target_file), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content_required': 'nano-compounds', 'content_excluded': 'plasmon mentions' }, 'search_terms': { 'nano_terms': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms': plasmon_terms, 'journal_indicators': scientific_reports_terms }, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(output_file)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã IDENTIFIED TARGET ARTICLES:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds") else: print(f"\nüîÑ RECOMMENDATION: Adjust filtering criteria or search additional sources") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Fix the variable scope issue by properly defining variables before using them in generator expressions print("Loading and filtering Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {os.path.basename(target_file)}") print(f"Total queries executed: {search_data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total results found: {search_data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}") # Extract detailed results detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nüìä Processing {len(detailed_results)} result sets...") # Collect all articles all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f" Result Set {i}: {len(results)} articles from query: {query[:50]}...") for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") # Define search terms outside the loop to avoid scope issues nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] scientific_reports_terms = [ 'scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep', 'nature.com/articles/srep', 'nature.com/subjects' ] print(f"\nüîç FILTERING CRITERIA:") print(f"‚úÖ Must contain: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds") print(f"‚ùå Must NOT contain: plasmon/plasmonic terms") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] # Process each article with proper variable scoping for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text BEFORE using it in any expressions title_text = title.lower() if title else '' snippet_text = snippet.lower() if snippet else '' link_text = link.lower() if link else '' combined_text = f"{title_text} {snippet_text} {link_text}" # Now apply filtering criteria with properly scoped variables is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text # Check for Scientific Reports indicators is_scientific_reports = False for term in scientific_reports_terms: if term in combined_text: is_scientific_reports = True break # Check for nano-compound terms has_nano_compound = False matching_nano_terms = [] for term in nano_terms: if term in combined_text: has_nano_compound = True matching_nano_terms.append(term) # Check for plasmon terms (we want articles WITHOUT these) has_plasmon = False for term in plasmon_terms: if term in combined_text: has_plasmon = True break # Article meets criteria if: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: target_articles.append({ 'article_id': len(target_articles) + 1, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source_query': article.get('source_query', ''), 'result_set': article.get('result_set', 0), 'matching_nano_terms': matching_nano_terms, 'criteria_analysis': { '2012': is_2012, 'scientific_reports': is_scientific_reports, 'nano_compound': has_nano_compound, 'no_plasmon': not has_plasmon } }) print(f"‚úÖ Target Article {len(target_articles)}:") print(f" Title: {title[:70]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(matching_nano_terms)}") print(f" URL: {link}") print() print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"FILTERING RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"Total articles processed: {len(all_articles)}") print(f"Target articles identified: {len(target_articles)}") # If no articles found, run diagnostic analysis if len(target_articles) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles met all criteria. Running diagnostic analysis...") # Count articles meeting individual criteria stats = { 'has_2012': 0, 'has_sci_rep': 0, 'has_nano': 0, 'has_plasmon': 0, 'meets_partial': 0 } for article in all_articles: title = article.get('title', '').lower() snippet = article.get('snippet', '').lower() link = article.get('link', '').lower() text = f"{title} {snippet} {link}" has_2012 = '2012' in text has_sci_rep = any(term in text for term in scientific_reports_terms) has_nano = any(term in text for term in nano_terms) has_plasmon = any(term in text for term in plasmon_terms) if has_2012: stats['has_2012'] += 1 if has_sci_rep: stats['has_sci_rep'] += 1 if has_nano: stats['has_nano'] += 1 if has_plasmon: stats['has_plasmon'] += 1 if has_2012 and has_sci_rep: stats['meets_partial'] += 1 print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {stats['has_2012']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {stats['has_sci_rep']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {stats['has_nano']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {stats['has_plasmon']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles meeting 2012 + Sci Rep: {stats['meets_partial']}/{len(all_articles)}") # Show sample articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i in range(min(5, len(all_articles))): article = all_articles[i] title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') text = f"{title.lower()} {article.get('snippet', '').lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" ‚úì 2012: {'2012' in text}") print(f" ‚úì Sci Rep: {any(term in text for term in scientific_reports_terms)}") print(f" ‚úì Nano: {any(term in text for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" ‚ùå Plasmon: {any(term in text for term in plasmon_terms)}") # Save results regardless of count timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") output_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': os.path.basename(target_file), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content_required': 'nano-compounds', 'content_excluded': 'plasmon mentions' }, 'search_terms_used': { 'nano_terms': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms': plasmon_terms, 'journal_indicators': scientific_reports_terms }, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(output_file)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã IDENTIFIED TARGET ARTICLES:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds") print(f"Note: Found {len(target_articles)} articles. PLAN mentions 23 target articles.") print(f"This discrepancy may be due to search limitations or strict filtering criteria.") else: print(f"\nüîÑ RECOMMENDATION: The search results may not contain the specific 23 articles") print(f"mentioned in the PLAN. Consider adjusting search terms or accessing articles directly.") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 16:49:14
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the filtering of Scientific Reports 2012 articles. The script successfully loaded the search results JSON file containing 139 articles from 10 search queries and applied comprehensive filtering criteria to identify target articles. It found 23 articles that meet the criteria: 2012 publication year + Scientific Reports journal + nano-compound content + no plasmon mentions. The output shows detailed information for each target article including titles, nano-compound terms found, and URLs. The filtering results saved to 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles_20250806_164903.json' for future reference. **PLAN** alignment: 95% complete - successfully identified the 23 target Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds without plasmon mentions. However, many of the identified articles appear to be journal category pages or search result pages rather than individual research articles (e.g., 'Browse Articles | Scientific Reports', 'Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports'). Next step: Access the actual full-text content of these articles to extract specific nano-compound names from their methodology, results, and abstract sections as required by the PLAN. The current results provide the foundation for full-text analysis but need to be validated as actual research articles rather than index pages.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # Fix the variable scope issue by properly defining variables before using them in generator expressions print("Loading and filtering Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("=" * 80) target_file = 'workspace/nature_scientific_reports_2012_search_results_20250806_163939.json' if os.path.exists(target_file): with open(target_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print(f"‚úÖ Successfully loaded: {os.path.basename(target_file)}") print(f"Total queries executed: {search_data.get('total_queries', 'N/A')}") print(f"Total results found: {search_data.get('total_results', 'N/A')}") # Extract detailed results detailed_results = search_data.get('detailed_results', []) print(f"\nüìä Processing {len(detailed_results)} result sets...") # Collect all articles all_articles = [] for i, result_set in enumerate(detailed_results, 1): query = result_set.get('query', 'Unknown query') results = result_set.get('results', []) print(f" Result Set {i}: {len(results)} articles from query: {query[:50]}...") for article in results: article_with_context = article.copy() article_with_context['source_query'] = query article_with_context['result_set'] = i all_articles.append(article_with_context) print(f"\nüìö TOTAL ARTICLES COLLECTED: {len(all_articles)}") # Define search terms outside the loop to avoid scope issues nano_terms = [ 'nano', 'nanoparticle', 'nanoscale', 'nanotube', 'nanostructure', 'nanocomposite', 'nanomaterial', 'quantum dot', 'graphene', 'nanocrystal', 'nanowire', 'nanorod', 'nanosheet', 'fullerene' ] plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic'] scientific_reports_terms = [ 'scientific reports', 'sci rep', 'nature.com/srep', 'nature.com/articles/srep', 'nature.com/subjects' ] print(f"\nüîç FILTERING CRITERIA:") print(f"‚úÖ Must contain: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds") print(f"‚ùå Must NOT contain: plasmon/plasmonic terms") print("-" * 60) target_articles = [] # Process each article with proper variable scoping for idx, article in enumerate(all_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') link = article.get('link', '') # Create combined text BEFORE using it in any expressions title_text = title.lower() if title else '' snippet_text = snippet.lower() if snippet else '' link_text = link.lower() if link else '' combined_text = f"{title_text} {snippet_text} {link_text}" # Now apply filtering criteria with properly scoped variables is_2012 = '2012' in combined_text # Check for Scientific Reports indicators is_scientific_reports = False for term in scientific_reports_terms: if term in combined_text: is_scientific_reports = True break # Check for nano-compound terms has_nano_compound = False matching_nano_terms = [] for term in nano_terms: if term in combined_text: has_nano_compound = True matching_nano_terms.append(term) # Check for plasmon terms (we want articles WITHOUT these) has_plasmon = False for term in plasmon_terms: if term in combined_text: has_plasmon = True break # Article meets criteria if: 2012 + Scientific Reports + nano-compounds + NO plasmons meets_criteria = is_2012 and is_scientific_reports and has_nano_compound and not has_plasmon if meets_criteria: target_articles.append({ 'article_id': len(target_articles) + 1, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'source_query': article.get('source_query', ''), 'result_set': article.get('result_set', 0), 'matching_nano_terms': matching_nano_terms, 'criteria_analysis': { '2012': is_2012, 'scientific_reports': is_scientific_reports, 'nano_compound': has_nano_compound, 'no_plasmon': not has_plasmon } }) print(f"‚úÖ Target Article {len(target_articles)}:") print(f" Title: {title[:70]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(matching_nano_terms)}") print(f" URL: {link}") print() print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"FILTERING RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"Total articles processed: {len(all_articles)}") print(f"Target articles identified: {len(target_articles)}") # If no articles found, run diagnostic analysis if len(target_articles) == 0: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No articles met all criteria. Running diagnostic analysis...") # Count articles meeting individual criteria stats = { 'has_2012': 0, 'has_sci_rep': 0, 'has_nano': 0, 'has_plasmon': 0, 'meets_partial': 0 } for article in all_articles: title = article.get('title', '').lower() snippet = article.get('snippet', '').lower() link = article.get('link', '').lower() text = f"{title} {snippet} {link}" has_2012 = '2012' in text has_sci_rep = any(term in text for term in scientific_reports_terms) has_nano = any(term in text for term in nano_terms) has_plasmon = any(term in text for term in plasmon_terms) if has_2012: stats['has_2012'] += 1 if has_sci_rep: stats['has_sci_rep'] += 1 if has_nano: stats['has_nano'] += 1 if has_plasmon: stats['has_plasmon'] += 1 if has_2012 and has_sci_rep: stats['meets_partial'] += 1 print(f"\nüìä DIAGNOSTIC BREAKDOWN:") print(f"Articles mentioning 2012: {stats['has_2012']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles from Scientific Reports: {stats['has_sci_rep']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with nano-compounds: {stats['has_nano']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles with plasmons (excluded): {stats['has_plasmon']}/{len(all_articles)}") print(f"Articles meeting 2012 + Sci Rep: {stats['meets_partial']}/{len(all_articles)}") # Show sample articles for debugging print(f"\nüîç SAMPLE ARTICLES FOR DEBUGGING:") for i in range(min(5, len(all_articles))): article = all_articles[i] title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') text = f"{title.lower()} {article.get('snippet', '').lower()} {link.lower()}" print(f"\n Sample {i+1}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" ‚úì 2012: {'2012' in text}") print(f" ‚úì Sci Rep: {any(term in text for term in scientific_reports_terms)}") print(f" ‚úì Nano: {any(term in text for term in nano_terms)}") print(f" ‚ùå Plasmon: {any(term in text for term in plasmon_terms)}") # Save results regardless of count timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") output_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles_{timestamp}.json' output_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': os.path.basename(target_file), 'total_articles_processed': len(all_articles), 'target_articles_found': len(target_articles), 'filtering_criteria': { 'year': '2012', 'journal': 'Scientific Reports', 'content_required': 'nano-compounds', 'content_excluded': 'plasmon mentions' }, 'search_terms_used': { 'nano_terms': nano_terms, 'plasmon_terms': plasmon_terms, 'journal_indicators': scientific_reports_terms }, 'target_articles': target_articles } with open(output_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(output_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(output_file)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nüìã IDENTIFIED TARGET ARTICLES:") print("-" * 80) for article in target_articles: print(f"{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" URL: {article['link']}") print() print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT STEP: Access full article content to identify specific nano-compounds") print(f"Note: Found {len(target_articles)} articles. PLAN mentions 23 target articles.") print(f"This discrepancy may be due to search limitations or strict filtering criteria.") else: print(f"\nüîÑ RECOMMENDATION: The search results may not contain the specific 23 articles") print(f"mentioned in the PLAN. Consider adjusting search terms or accessing articles directly.") else: print(f"‚ùå Error: File {target_file} not found") if os.path.exists('workspace'): print("Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: print("Workspace directory not found")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 7)

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the filtered results file to understand what was captured print("Inspecting the filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the most recent filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file (they're timestamped) latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # Load and inspect the structure with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with keys {list(value.keys())}") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") # Examine the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä TARGET ARTICLES ANALYSIS:") print(f"Total target articles: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nSample article structure:") sample = target_articles[0] print(f"Keys: {list(sample.keys())}") print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES:") print("-" * 60) # Categorize the articles to understand what we actually captured categories = { 'journal_pages': [], # Nature.com journal browsing pages 'search_pages': [], # Search result pages 'actual_papers': [], # Potential actual research papers 'other_sites': [], # Non-Nature.com sites 'cv_profiles': [], # CV/profile pages 'unrelated': [] # Clearly unrelated content } for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n{i}. {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL and title patterns if 'nature.com/srep/articles' in link or 'nature.com/subjects' in link: if 'Browse Articles' in title or 'Articles in 2012' in title: categories['journal_pages'].append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing page") else: categories['search_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Search/category page") elif 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: categories['actual_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential actual paper") elif any(domain in link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): categories['actual_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential actual paper (external)") elif any(term in link.lower() for term in ['.pdf', 'cv']): categories['cv_profiles'].append(article) print(f" üë§ Category: CV/Profile page") elif 'nature.com' not in link: categories['other_sites'].append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other website") else: categories['unrelated'].append(article) print(f" ‚ùì Category: Unrelated/unclear") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) for category, articles in categories.items(): print(f"{category.replace('_', ' ').title()}: {len(articles)} articles") # Focus on the most promising actual papers potential_papers = categories['actual_papers'] if potential_papers: print(f"\nüìÑ POTENTIAL ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS ({len(potential_papers)}):") print("-" * 60) for i, paper in enumerate(potential_papers, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {paper['title']}") print(f" URL: {paper['link']}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper['matching_nano_terms'])}") print(f" Snippet: {paper['snippet'][:200]}...") # The main issue: we need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 papers print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND NEXT STEPS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüîç CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Most captured 'articles' are journal browsing/search pages, not actual papers") print(f"- We need to access individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles") print(f"- The PLAN mentions 23 specific articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"\nüí° RECOMMENDED APPROACH:") print(f"1. Use the journal browsing pages to find actual 2012 articles") print(f"2. Access individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Extract full-text content from each article") print(f"4. Analyze methodology, results, and abstracts for nano-compound names") # Check if we have any direct links to 2012 Scientific Reports articles direct_article_links = [] for article in target_articles: link = article.get('link', '') if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link or 'srep' in link: direct_article_links.append(article) print(f"\nüìã DIRECT ARTICLE LINKS FOUND: {len(direct_article_links)}") if direct_article_links: for i, article in enumerate(direct_article_links, 1): print(f" {i}. {article['title']}") print(f" {article['link']}") # Save analysis results analysis_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/filtered_articles_analysis_{analysis_timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_file, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': {cat: len(articles) for cat, articles in categories.items()}, 'potential_research_papers': potential_papers, 'direct_article_links': direct_article_links, 'assessment': { 'issue': 'Most results are journal pages, not individual research articles', 'solution': 'Need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research papers', 'next_step': 'Extract individual article URLs and access full content' } } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT ACTION REQUIRED:") print(f"Need to implement a strategy to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"studying nano-compounds, rather than journal browsing pages.")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 16:50:38
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 87 due to undefined variable 'link' in the generator expression within the list comprehension. The code successfully loaded and analyzed the filtered articles file containing 23 target articles, properly inspected the file structure, and began categorizing the articles by type (journal pages, search pages, actual papers, etc.). However, it crashed when trying to filter for articles containing certain domain names because 'link' was referenced in a generator expression outside its proper scope. **PLAN** alignment: 85% - data loaded, structure analyzed, and article categorization started, but analysis incomplete due to the variable scope error. The analysis correctly identified that most captured 'articles' are journal browsing/search pages rather than actual research papers, which is a critical insight for the PLAN. Recommended fix: Move the 'link' variable extraction (link = article.get('link', '')) before the generator expression that uses it around line 87, or restructure the filtering logic to define variables in the correct scope. The code shows excellent diagnostic analysis and correctly identifies the core issue: we need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles rather than journal index pages to complete the nano-compound identification task.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the filtered results file to understand what was captured print("Inspecting the filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the most recent filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file (they're timestamped) latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # Load and inspect the structure with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with keys {list(value.keys())}") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") # Examine the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä TARGET ARTICLES ANALYSIS:") print(f"Total target articles: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: print(f"\nSample article structure:") sample = target_articles[0] print(f"Keys: {list(sample.keys())}") print(f"\nüîç ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES:") print("-" * 60) # Categorize the articles to understand what we actually captured categories = { 'journal_pages': [], # Nature.com journal browsing pages 'search_pages': [], # Search result pages 'actual_papers': [], # Potential actual research papers 'other_sites': [], # Non-Nature.com sites 'cv_profiles': [], # CV/profile pages 'unrelated': [] # Clearly unrelated content } for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n{i}. {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # 2025-08-06 16:51:32
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 8)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered results file structure print("Inspecting filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure without processing with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Examine each key safely for key in filtered_data.keys(): value = filtered_data[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Now examine the target articles structure target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä TARGET ARTICLES STRUCTURE:") print(f"Total target articles: {len(target_articles)}") if len(target_articles) > 0: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"\nSample article keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") # Show sample values for each key for key in sample_article.keys(): value = sample_article[key] if isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: '{value[:100]}...'") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES AND CONTENT") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles with proper variable scoping categories = { 'journal_browsing_pages': [], 'search_result_pages': [], 'potential_research_papers': [], 'external_sites': [], 'cv_profile_pages': [], 'unrelated_content': [] } for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables first to avoid scope issues article_title = article.get('title', '') article_link = article.get('link', '') article_snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {article_title}") print(f" URL: {article_link}") print(f" Nano terms found: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {article_snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize with proper variable scoping if 'nature.com/srep/articles' in article_link: if 'Browse Articles' in article_title or 'Articles in 2012' in article_title: categories['journal_browsing_pages'].append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing page") else: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Search result page") elif 'nature.com/articles/srep' in article_link: categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential research paper") elif 'nature.com/subjects' in article_link: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Subject category page") elif any(domain in article_link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") elif '.pdf' in article_link.lower() or 'cv' in article_link.lower(): categories['cv_profile_pages'].append(article) print(f" üë§ Category: CV/Profile page") elif 'nature.com' not in article_link: categories['external_sites'].append(article) print(f" üåê Category: External website") else: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" ‚ùì Category: Unrelated/unclear") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) for category_name, articles_list in categories.items(): formatted_name = category_name.replace('_', ' ').title() print(f"{formatted_name}: {len(articles_list)} articles") # Focus on potential research papers research_papers = categories['potential_research_papers'] print(f"\nüìÑ POTENTIAL RESEARCH PAPERS ANALYSIS:") print("-" * 60) if len(research_papers) > 0: print(f"Found {len(research_papers)} potential research papers:") for i, paper in enumerate(research_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n {i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") else: print(f"No direct research paper links found in the filtered results.") print(f"Most results are journal browsing or category pages.") # Analyze the core issue print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ISSUE ANALYSIS AND SOLUTION STRATEGY") print(f"=" * 80) browsing_pages = len(categories['journal_browsing_pages']) search_pages = len(categories['search_result_pages']) actual_papers = len(categories['potential_research_papers']) print(f"\nüîç CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Journal browsing pages: {browsing_pages}") print(f"- Search/category pages: {search_pages}") print(f"- Potential research papers: {actual_papers}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"\n‚ùó CORE ISSUE IDENTIFIED:") print(f"The search results contain mostly journal navigation pages rather than") print(f"individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"\nüí° SOLUTION STRATEGY:") print(f"1. Need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles") print(f"2. Look for articles with URLs like: nature.com/articles/srep[number]") print(f"3. Extract full-text content from each article") print(f"4. Analyze abstracts, methodology, and results for specific nano-compound names") # Check if we can extract any useful browsing page URLs to find actual articles browsing_urls = [] for article in categories['journal_browsing_pages'] + categories['search_result_pages']: url = article.get('link', '') if 'nature.com' in url and '2012' in url: browsing_urls.append(url) print(f"\nüîó BROWSING PAGES THAT MIGHT CONTAIN 2012 ARTICLES:") print(f"Found {len(browsing_urls)} relevant browsing URLs:") for i, url in enumerate(browsing_urls[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {url}") # Save analysis results analysis_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_results_{analysis_timestamp}.json' analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_file, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization_summary': {cat: len(arts) for cat, arts in categories.items()}, 'potential_research_papers': research_papers, 'browsing_urls_for_2012': browsing_urls, 'issue_identified': 'Most results are journal pages, not individual research articles', 'next_steps': [ 'Access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles', 'Extract full-text content from individual articles', 'Analyze content for specific nano-compound names' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Analysis results saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ RECOMMENDATION FOR NEXT STEP:") print(f"Implement a targeted search or access strategy to find actual") print(f"Scientific Reports 2012 research articles studying nano-compounds,") print(f"rather than journal browsing pages.")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError due to undefined variable 'article_link' in generator expression on line 108. The code successfully loaded the filtered articles file containing 23 target articles from 139 processed articles and properly analyzed the file structure. It began categorizing articles by type (journal browsing pages, search result pages, potential research papers, etc.) and correctly processed the first 3 articles, identifying them as subject category pages and journal browsing pages. However, it crashed when processing article #3 because 'article_link' was referenced in a generator expression before being defined in the loop scope. **PLAN** alignment: 80% - data loaded, structure analyzed, and article categorization started with valuable insights, but analysis incomplete due to variable scope error. The analysis correctly identified the core issue: most of the 23 'target articles' are actually journal navigation pages rather than individual Scientific Reports 2012 research papers studying nano-compounds. Recommended fix: Replace 'article_link' with 'link' in the generator expression on line 108, or ensure proper variable scoping. The diagnostic approach is excellent and reveals that we need to access actual research article URLs (like nature.com/articles/srep#####) rather than journal index pages to complete the nano-compound identification task from the PLAN.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered results file structure print("Inspecting filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure without processing with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Examine each key safely for key in filtered_data.keys(): value = filtered_data[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0: print(f" First item type: {type(value[0])}") if isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Now examine the target articles structure target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä TARGET ARTICLES STRUCTURE:") print(f"Total target articles: {len(target_articles)}") if len(target_articles) > 0: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"\nSample article keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") # Show sample values for each key for key in sample_article.keys(): value = sample_article[key] if isinstance(value, str): print(f" {key}: '{value[:100]}...'") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {value}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES AND CONTENT") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles with proper variable scoping categories = { 'journal_browsing_pages': [], 'search_result_pages': [], 'potential_research_papers': [], 'external_sites': [], 'cv_profile_pages': [], 'unrelated_content': [] } for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables first to avoid scope issues article_title = article.get('title', '') article_link = article.get('link', '') article_snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {article_title}") print(f" URL: {article_link}") print(f" Nano terms found: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {article_snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize with proper variable scoping if 'nature.com/srep/articles' in article_link: if 'Browse Articles' in article_title or 'Articles in 2012' in article_title: categories['journal_browsing_pages'].append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing page") else: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Search result page") elif 'nature.com/articles/srep' in article_link: categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential research paper") elif 'nature.com/subjects' in article_link: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Subject category page") elif any(domain in article_link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") elif '.pdf' in article_link.lower() or 'cv' in article_link.lower(): categories['cv_profile_pages'].append(article) print(f" üë§ Category: CV/Profile page") elif 'nature.com' not in article_link: categories['external_sites'].append(article) print(f" üåê Category: External website") else: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" ‚ùì Category: Unrelated/unclear") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) for category_name, articles_list in categories.items(): formatted_name = category_name.replace('_', ' ').title() print(f"{formatted_name}: {len(articles_list)} articles") # Focus on potential research papers research_papers = categories['potential_research_papers'] print(f"\nüìÑ POTENTIAL RESEARCH PAPERS ANALYSIS:") print("-" * 60) if len(research_papers) > 0: print(f"Found {len(research_papers)} potential research papers:") for i, paper in enumerate(research_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n {i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") else: print(f"No direct research paper links found in the filtered results.") print(f"Most results are journal browsing or category pages.") # Analyze the core issue print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ISSUE ANALYSIS AND SOLUTION STRATEGY") print(f"=" * 80) browsing_pages = len(categories['journal_browsing_pages']) search_pages = len(categories['search_result_pages']) actual_papers = len(categories['potential_research_papers']) print(f"\nüîç CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Journal browsing pages: {browsing_pages}") print(f"- Search/category pages: {search_pages}") print(f"- Potential research papers: {actual_papers}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"\n‚ùó CORE ISSUE IDENTIFIED:") print(f"The search results contain mostly journal navigation pages rather than") print(f"individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"\nüí° SOLUTION STRATEGY:") print(f"1. Need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles") print(f"2. Look for articles with URLs like: nature.com/articles/srep[number]") print(f"3. Extract full-text content from each article") print(f"4. Analyze abstracts, methodology, and results for specific nano-compound names") # Check if we can extract any useful browsing page URLs to find actual articles browsing_urls = [] for article in categories['journal_browsing_pages'] + categories['search_result_pages']: url = article.get('link', '') if 'nature.com' in url and '2012' in url: browsing_urls.append(url) print(f"\nüîó BROWSING PAGES THAT MIGHT CONTAIN 2012 ARTICLES:") print(f"Found {len(browsing_urls)} relevant browsing URLs:") for i, url in enumerate(browsing_urls[:5], 1): print(f" {i}. {url}") # Save analysis results analysis_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_results_{analysis_timestamp}.json' analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_file, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization_summary': {cat: len(arts) for cat, arts in categories.items()}, 'potential_research_papers': research_papers, 'browsing_urls_for_2012': browsing_urls, 'issue_identified': 'Most results are journal pages, not individual research articles', 'next_steps': [ 'Access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles', 'Extract full-text content from individual articles', 'Analyze content for specific nano-compound names' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Analysis results saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ RECOMMENDATION FOR NEXT STEP:") print(f"Implement a targeted search or access strategy to find actual") print(f"Scientific Reports 2012 research articles studying nano-compounds,") print(f"rather than journal browsing pages.")
