Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered results file structure print("Inspecting filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nLoading and analyzing: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # Load the file safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File loaded successfully") print(f"Total target articles: {filtered_data.get('target_articles_found', 0)}") # Get the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categories for different types of results categories = { 'journal_browsing_pages': [], 'search_result_pages': [], 'potential_research_papers': [], 'external_research_sites': [], 'profile_cv_pages': [], 'unrelated_content': [] } # Process each article with proper variable scoping for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables at the beginning of the loop to avoid scope issues title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns (with properly scoped variables) if 'nature.com/srep/articles' in link: if 'Browse Articles' in title or 'Articles in 2012' in title: categories['journal_browsing_pages'].append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing page") else: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Search result page") elif 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential research paper") elif 'nature.com/subjects' in link: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Subject category page") elif 'pubs.acs.org' in link or 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' in link: categories['external_research_sites'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") elif '.pdf' in link.lower() or 'cv' in link.lower(): categories['profile_cv_pages'].append(article) print(f" üë§ Category: CV/Profile page") elif 'nature.com' not in link: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" üåê Category: External/unrelated site") else: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" ‚ùì Category: Unclear/other") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) for category_name, article_list in categories.items(): formatted_name = category_name.replace('_', ' ').title() print(f"{formatted_name}: {len(article_list)} articles") # Analyze the actual research papers found research_papers = categories['potential_research_papers'] + categories['external_research_sites'] print(f"\nüìÑ POTENTIAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND: {len(research_papers)}") print("-" * 60) if research_papers: print(f"Identified {len(research_papers)} potential research papers:") for i, paper in enumerate(research_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n {i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") else: print(f"No direct research paper links found.") # Extract browsing pages that might contain actual 2012 articles browsing_pages = categories['journal_browsing_pages'] + categories['search_result_pages'] print(f"\nüìÇ JOURNAL BROWSING/SEARCH PAGES: {len(browsing_pages)}") print("-" * 60) useful_browsing_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_link = page.get('link', '') page_title = page.get('title', '') # Look for pages that specifically mention 2012 or could contain 2012 articles if ('2012' in page_link or '2012' in page_title) and 'nature.com' in page_link: useful_browsing_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'potential': 'Contains 2012 articles' }) print(f" üìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüîç CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"- Direct research papers found: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- Useful 2012 browsing URLs: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") print(f"\n‚ùó CORE ISSUE IDENTIFIED:") print(f"The search results primarily contain journal navigation and category pages") print(f"rather than individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles.") print(f"To complete the PLAN, we need access to actual research papers.") print(f"\nüí° RECOMMENDED STRATEGY:") print(f"1. Use the browsing page URLs to access lists of 2012 Scientific Reports articles") print(f"2. Extract individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, and results") # Identify the most promising browsing URLs for accessing 2012 articles priority_urls = [] for url_info in useful_browsing_urls: url = url_info['url'] if 'year=2012' in url or 'Articles in 2012' in url_info['title']: priority_urls.append(url_info) print(f"\nüéØ HIGH-PRIORITY BROWSING URLS FOR 2012 ARTICLES:") print(f"Found {len(priority_urls)} high-priority URLs:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_type_analysis_{analysis_timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_file, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { category: len(articles) for category, articles in categories.items() }, 'potential_research_papers': research_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'priority_urls_for_2012': priority_urls, 'assessment': { 'issue': 'Most results are journal pages, not individual research articles', 'solution': 'Need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research papers', 'next_step': 'Use browsing URLs to find individual article links' }, 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'current': f'{len(research_papers)} potential research papers identified', 'gap': 'Need to access more individual research articles' } } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. Access the high-priority browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to Scientific Reports 2012 research papers") print(f"3. Download and analyze full-text content of each paper") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results") print(f"\nThis will allow us to identify the specific nano-compounds studied in each") print(f"of the 23 target Scientific Reports 2012 articles as required by the PLAN.")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed a comprehensive analysis of the 23 filtered articles. The script successfully loaded the filtered articles file, properly analyzed the data structure, and systematically categorized each article by type. The analysis reveals a critical insight: most of the 23 'target articles' are actually journal browsing pages, subject category pages, or external sites rather than individual Scientific Reports 2012 research papers. The code identified only 3 potential research papers out of 23 articles, with the majority being journal navigation pages (5), search result pages (5), profile/CV pages (3), and unrelated content (7). **PLAN** alignment: 90% complete - successfully analyzed the filtered results and identified the core issue blocking progress. The analysis correctly determined that we need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles (with URLs like nature.com/articles/srep#####) rather than journal index pages to extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results sections. Recommendation: Save the detailed analysis output to 'workspace/article_type_analysis_summary.json' for future reference, then implement a targeted strategy to access individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles studying nano-compounds to complete the PLAN requirements.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered results file structure print("Inspecting filtered articles file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the filtered results file filtered_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in file: filtered_files.append(file) print(f"Found filtered file: {file}") if not filtered_files: print("No filtered articles file found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent file latest_file = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_file}' print(f"\nLoading and analyzing: {latest_file}") print("-" * 60) # Load the file safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File loaded successfully") print(f"Total target articles: {filtered_data.get('target_articles_found', 0)}") # Get the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLE TYPES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categories for different types of results categories = { 'journal_browsing_pages': [], 'search_result_pages': [], 'potential_research_papers': [], 'external_research_sites': [], 'profile_cv_pages': [], 'unrelated_content': [] } # Process each article with proper variable scoping for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables at the beginning of the loop to avoid scope issues title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title}") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns (with properly scoped variables) if 'nature.com/srep/articles' in link: if 'Browse Articles' in title or 'Articles in 2012' in title: categories['journal_browsing_pages'].append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing page") else: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Search result page") elif 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: categories['potential_research_papers'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Potential research paper") elif 'nature.com/subjects' in link: categories['search_result_pages'].append(article) print(f" üîç Category: Subject category page") elif 'pubs.acs.org' in link or 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' in link: categories['external_research_sites'].append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") elif '.pdf' in link.lower() or 'cv' in link.lower(): categories['profile_cv_pages'].append(article) print(f" üë§ Category: CV/Profile page") elif 'nature.com' not in link: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" üåê Category: External/unrelated site") else: categories['unrelated_content'].append(article) print(f" ‚ùì Category: Unclear/other") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) for category_name, article_list in categories.items(): formatted_name = category_name.replace('_', ' ').title() print(f"{formatted_name}: {len(article_list)} articles") # Analyze the actual research papers found research_papers = categories['potential_research_papers'] + categories['external_research_sites'] print(f"\nüìÑ POTENTIAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND: {len(research_papers)}") print("-" * 60) if research_papers: print(f"Identified {len(research_papers)} potential research papers:") for i, paper in enumerate(research_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') print(f"\n {i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") else: print(f"No direct research paper links found.") # Extract browsing pages that might contain actual 2012 articles browsing_pages = categories['journal_browsing_pages'] + categories['search_result_pages'] print(f"\nüìÇ JOURNAL BROWSING/SEARCH PAGES: {len(browsing_pages)}") print("-" * 60) useful_browsing_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_link = page.get('link', '') page_title = page.get('title', '') # Look for pages that specifically mention 2012 or could contain 2012 articles if ('2012' in page_link or '2012' in page_title) and 'nature.com' in page_link: useful_browsing_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'potential': 'Contains 2012 articles' }) print(f" üìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüîç CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") print(f"- Direct research papers found: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- Useful 2012 browsing URLs: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") print(f"\n‚ùó CORE ISSUE IDENTIFIED:") print(f"The search results primarily contain journal navigation and category pages") print(f"rather than individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles.") print(f"To complete the PLAN, we need access to actual research papers.") print(f"\nüí° RECOMMENDED STRATEGY:") print(f"1. Use the browsing page URLs to access lists of 2012 Scientific Reports articles") print(f"2. Extract individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, and results") # Identify the most promising browsing URLs for accessing 2012 articles priority_urls = [] for url_info in useful_browsing_urls: url = url_info['url'] if 'year=2012' in url or 'Articles in 2012' in url_info['title']: priority_urls.append(url_info) print(f"\nüéØ HIGH-PRIORITY BROWSING URLS FOR 2012 ARTICLES:") print(f"Found {len(priority_urls)} high-priority URLs:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") # Save comprehensive analysis analysis_timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_type_analysis_{analysis_timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_file, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { category: len(articles) for category, articles in categories.items() }, 'potential_research_papers': research_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'priority_urls_for_2012': priority_urls, 'assessment': { 'issue': 'Most results are journal pages, not individual research articles', 'solution': 'Need to access actual Scientific Reports 2012 research papers', 'next_step': 'Use browsing URLs to find individual article links' }, 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'current': f'{len(research_papers)} potential research papers identified', 'gap': 'Need to access more individual research articles' } } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. Access the high-priority browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to Scientific Reports 2012 research papers") print(f"3. Download and analyze full-text content of each paper") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results") print(f"\nThis will allow us to identify the specific nano-compounds studied in each") print(f"of the 23 target Scientific Reports 2012 articles as required by the PLAN.")

Extract individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####) 3. Access full-text content of each article 4. Access the high-priority browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles 2. Extract direct links to Scientific Reports 2012 research papers 3. Download and analyze full-text content of each paper 4. Extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results This will allow us to identify the specific nano-compounds studied in each of the 23 target Scientific Reports 2012 articles as required by the PLAN.
developer
2025-08-06 16:54:24
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 10)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the analysis file to understand what browsing URLs we have print("Inspecting analysis files to find browsing URLs for 2012 articles...") print("="*80) # Find the most recent analysis file analysis_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'article_type_analysis' in file or 'article_analysis_results' in file: analysis_files.append(file) print(f"Found analysis file: {file}") if not analysis_files: print("No analysis files found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent analysis file latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_analysis}") print("-"*60) # First, inspect the file structure to understand its contents with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Analysis file structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Examine each key to understand the data structure for key in analysis_data.keys(): value = analysis_data[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys - {list(value.keys())[:3]}...") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Look for browsing URLs specifically for 2012 articles priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_urls_for_2012', []) useful_browsing_urls = analysis_data.get('useful_browsing_urls', []) print(f"\nüìä BROWSING URL ANALYSIS:") print(f"Priority URLs for 2012: {len(priority_urls)}") print(f"Useful browsing URLs: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") # Display the priority URLs if priority_urls: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH-PRIORITY 2012 BROWSING URLS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f" {url_info.get('url', 'No URL')}") # Since we need to access actual Scientific Reports articles, let's try a different approach # We'll use a targeted search to find specific Scientific Reports 2012 articles about nano-compounds print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"TARGETED SEARCH FOR SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 NANO-COMPOUND ARTICLES") print(f"="*80) # Get SerpAPI key for targeted search api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("No SerpAPI key found. Will proceed with available browsing URLs.") # Use the browsing URLs we have target_urls = [] for url_info in priority_urls + useful_browsing_urls: url = url_info.get('url', '') if 'nature.com' in url and ('2012' in url or 'srep' in url): target_urls.append(url) print(f"\nüìã AVAILABLE BROWSING URLS TO ACCESS: {len(target_urls)}") for i, url in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url}") print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NOTE: To access full article content, we would need:") print(f"1. Web scraping capabilities to parse Nature.com pages") print(f"2. Access to individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Ability to extract full-text content from each article") else: print(f"SerpAPI key found. Conducting targeted search for specific articles...") # Define very specific search queries to find actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles specific_queries = [ 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanoparticle', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 graphene', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 quantum dot', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanotube', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanocrystal', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanowire', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanocomposite', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 fullerene', ] print(f"\nExecuting {len(specific_queries)} targeted searches for actual articles...") all_article_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(specific_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(specific_queries)}: {query}") print("-"*40) # Prepare API request params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } try: response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results") # Filter for actual Scientific Reports articles for j, result in enumerate(results['organic_results'], 1): title = result.get('title', '') link = result.get('link', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') # Check if this is an actual Scientific Reports article if ('nature.com/articles/srep' in link and '2012' in snippet and any(term in (title + snippet).lower() for term in ['nano', 'quantum', 'graphene'])): all_article_results.append({ 'title': title, 'url': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_query': query, 'nano_terms_detected': [term for term in ['nano', 'nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum', 'nanotube'] if term in (title + snippet).lower()] }) print(f" ‚úÖ Article {len(all_article_results)}: {title[:50]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {[term for term in ['nano', 'nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum', 'nanotube'] if term in (title + snippet).lower()]}") else: print(f" ‚ùå Not a target article: {title[:50]}...") else: print(f"No results found") else: print(f"API error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Search error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"TARGETED SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"="*80) print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND: {len(all_article_results)}") if all_article_results: print(f"\nIdentified Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds:") for i, article in enumerate(all_article_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Nano-compounds detected: {', '.join(article['nano_terms_detected'])}") print(f" Snippet: {article['snippet'][:200]}...") # Save the found articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_actual_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search for actual articles', 'total_articles_found': len(all_article_results), 'search_queries_used': specific_queries, 'articles': all_article_results, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract specific nano-compound names' } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Articles saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Access the full-text content of these {len(all_article_results)} Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"to extract specific nano-compound names from their abstracts, methodology, and results sections.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles found in targeted search.") print(f"This suggests the articles may require direct access to Nature.com or different search strategies.") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Access Nature.com Scientific Reports 2012 archive directly") print(f"2. Use academic databases like PubMed or Google Scholar") print(f"3. Access institutional library databases") print(f"4. Use web scraping on the browsing URLs we identified")
Execution Output

tester
2025-08-06 16:54:24
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code executed properly and loaded the analysis file successfully, but the targeted search for actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles produced garbled and incorrect output. The output shows fragments of unrelated content (Replit blog posts) mixed with the search analysis, indicating a major execution error in the SerpAPI search section. **CURRENT CODE OUTPUT** shows corrupted data with error messages like 'name 'page_text' is not defined' and content completely unrelated to Scientific Reports articles. The code successfully identified 2 high-priority browsing URLs for 2012 Scientific Reports articles from the previous analysis, but the targeted search implementation failed catastrophically. **PLAN** alignment: 30% - while the initial analysis was correct, the core search functionality to find actual research articles completely malfunctioned. The output is corrupted and contains no usable Scientific Reports 2012 article information. Recommended fix: Debug the SerpAPI search implementation, remove the corrupted search logic that's producing Replit blog content instead of Scientific Reports articles, and implement a clean targeted search specifically for nature.com/articles/srep URLs from 2012 studying nano-compounds. The browsing URLs identified (nature.com/srep/articles?year=2012&page=3 and page=12) should be used as the foundation for finding actual research articles.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the analysis file to understand what browsing URLs we have print("Inspecting analysis files to find browsing URLs for 2012 articles...") print("="*80) # Find the most recent analysis file analysis_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): if 'article_type_analysis' in file or 'article_analysis_results' in file: analysis_files.append(file) print(f"Found analysis file: {file}") if not analysis_files: print("No analysis files found. Available files in workspace:") if os.path.exists('workspace'): for file in os.listdir('workspace'): print(f" - {file}") else: # Use the most recent analysis file latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nInspecting: {latest_analysis}") print("-"*60) # First, inspect the file structure to understand its contents with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) print(f"Analysis file structure:") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(analysis_data.keys())}") # Examine each key to understand the data structure for key in analysis_data.keys(): value = analysis_data[key] if isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys - {list(value.keys())[:3]}...") elif isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value)} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Look for browsing URLs specifically for 2012 articles priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_urls_for_2012', []) useful_browsing_urls = analysis_data.get('useful_browsing_urls', []) print(f"\nüìä BROWSING URL ANALYSIS:") print(f"Priority URLs for 2012: {len(priority_urls)}") print(f"Useful browsing URLs: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") # Display the priority URLs if priority_urls: print(f"\nüéØ HIGH-PRIORITY 2012 BROWSING URLS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f" {url_info.get('url', 'No URL')}") # Since we need to access actual Scientific Reports articles, let's try a different approach # We'll use a targeted search to find specific Scientific Reports 2012 articles about nano-compounds print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"TARGETED SEARCH FOR SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 NANO-COMPOUND ARTICLES") print(f"="*80) # Get SerpAPI key for targeted search api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("No SerpAPI key found. Will proceed with available browsing URLs.") # Use the browsing URLs we have target_urls = [] for url_info in priority_urls + useful_browsing_urls: url = url_info.get('url', '') if 'nature.com' in url and ('2012' in url or 'srep' in url): target_urls.append(url) print(f"\nüìã AVAILABLE BROWSING URLS TO ACCESS: {len(target_urls)}") for i, url in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url}") print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NOTE: To access full article content, we would need:") print(f"1. Web scraping capabilities to parse Nature.com pages") print(f"2. Access to individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Ability to extract full-text content from each article") else: print(f"SerpAPI key found. Conducting targeted search for specific articles...") # Define very specific search queries to find actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles specific_queries = [ 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanoparticle', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 graphene', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 quantum dot', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanotube', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanocrystal', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanowire', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 nanocomposite', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "Scientific Reports" 2012 fullerene', ] print(f"\nExecuting {len(specific_queries)} targeted searches for actual articles...") all_article_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(specific_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(specific_queries)}: {query}") print("-"*40) # Prepare API request params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 10, "type": "search" } try: response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() if results.get("organic_results"): print(f"Found {len(results['organic_results'])} results") # Filter for actual Scientific Reports articles for j, result in enumerate(results['organic_results'], 1): title = result.get('title', '') link = result.get('link', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') # Check if this is an actual Scientific Reports article if ('nature.com/articles/srep' in link and '2012' in snippet and any(term in (title + snippet).lower() for term in ['nano', 'quantum', 'graphene'])): all_article_results.append({ 'title': title, 'url': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_query': query, 'nano_terms_detected': [term for term in ['nano', 'nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum', 'nanotube'] if term in (title + snippet).lower()] }) print(f" ‚úÖ Article {len(all_article_results)}: {title[:50]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {[term for term in ['nano', 'nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum', 'nanotube'] if term in (title + snippet).lower()]}") else: print(f" ‚ùå Not a target article: {title[:50]}...") else: print(f"No results found") else: print(f"API error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"Search error: {str(e)}") print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"TARGETED SEARCH RESULTS") print(f"="*80) print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND: {len(all_article_results)}") if all_article_results: print(f"\nIdentified Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds:") for i, article in enumerate(all_article_results, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Nano-compounds detected: {', '.join(article['nano_terms_detected'])}") print(f" Snippet: {article['snippet'][:200]}...") # Save the found articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_actual_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search for actual articles', 'total_articles_found': len(all_article_results), 'search_queries_used': specific_queries, 'articles': all_article_results, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract specific nano-compound names' } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Articles saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Access the full-text content of these {len(all_article_results)} Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"to extract specific nano-compound names from their abstracts, methodology, and results sections.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è No actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles found in targeted search.") print(f"This suggests the articles may require direct access to Nature.com or different search strategies.") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Access Nature.com Scientific Reports 2012 archive directly") print(f"2. Use academic databases like PubMed or Google Scholar") print(f"3. Access institutional library databases") print(f"4. Use web scraping on the browsing URLs we identified")
Execution Output

developer
2025-08-06 16:56:10
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 11)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from datetime import datetime import time # First, let's properly inspect what we have in workspace to understand our current data print("Inspecting workspace files to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Look for the most recent filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # Safely inspect the file structure first with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: try: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File loaded successfully") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Get basic info total_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles_found', 0) target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"Total target articles: {total_articles}") print(f"Articles list length: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Error loading JSON: {e}") target_articles = [] else: print("No filtered articles file found") target_articles = [] # Now let's implement a clean strategy to find actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"IMPLEMENTING TARGETED SEARCH FOR ACTUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) # Get API key api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("‚ùå No SerpAPI key found. Cannot perform targeted search.") print("\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACH NEEDED:") print("Without API access, we would need to:") print("1. Use web scraping to access Nature.com browsing pages") print("2. Extract individual article URLs from those pages") print("3. Access each article's full content") print("4. Parse abstracts, methods, and results for nano-compound names") else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found. Implementing targeted search strategy...") # Define very specific search queries for actual Scientific Reports articles # Focus on finding individual articles with specific nano-compound terms targeted_queries = [ 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanoparticle -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" graphene -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" "quantum dot" -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanotube carbon -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanowire -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanocrystal -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" fullerene -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanocomposite -plasmon' ] print(f"\nExecuting {len(targeted_queries)} targeted searches...") found_articles = [] search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(targeted_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(targeted_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 50) # Prepare search parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 15, # Get more results for better coverage "type": "search" } try: # Make API request with timeout response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() # Store raw results search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'results': results.get('organic_results', []), 'search_number': i }) organic_results = results.get('organic_results', []) print(f"Found {len(organic_results)} results") # Filter for actual Scientific Reports articles for j, result in enumerate(organic_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') link = result.get('link', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') print(f" {j}. {title[:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") # Check if this is an actual Scientific Reports article from 2012 is_srep_article = 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link has_2012 = '2012' in (title + snippet) has_nano_terms = any(term in (title + snippet).lower() for term in ['nano', 'quantum', 'graphene', 'carbon', 'fullerene']) no_plasmon = 'plasmon' not in (title + snippet).lower() print(f" ‚úì SREP article: {is_srep_article}") print(f" ‚úì Contains 2012: {has_2012}") print(f" ‚úì Nano terms: {has_nano_terms}") print(f" ‚úì No plasmon: {no_plasmon}") if is_srep_article and has_2012 and has_nano_terms and no_plasmon: # Extract nano terms found nano_terms_found = [] nano_keywords = ['nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum dot', 'nanotube', 'nanowire', 'nanocrystal', 'fullerene', 'nanocomposite', 'carbon nanotube'] combined_text = (title + ' ' + snippet).lower() for keyword in nano_keywords: if keyword in combined_text: nano_terms_found.append(keyword) found_articles.append({ 'title': title, 'url': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_query': query, 'nano_terms_detected': nano_terms_found, 'article_id': len(found_articles) + 1 }) print(f" üéØ MATCH! Article #{len(found_articles)}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms_found)}") else: print(f" ‚ùå Not a target article") print() else: print(f"API error: Status {response.status_code}") search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', 'search_number': i }) except Exception as e: print(f"Search error: {str(e)}") search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'error': str(e), 'search_number': i }) # Small delay between requests to be respectful time.sleep(1) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total searches executed: {len(targeted_queries)}") print(f"Successful searches: {len([r for r in search_results if 'error' not in r])}") print(f"Total articles found: {len(found_articles)}") if found_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-" * 60) for article in found_articles: print(f"\n{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['nano_terms_detected'])}") print(f" Snippet: {article['snippet'][:200]}...") # Save the found articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_target_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search for actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles', 'total_articles_found': len(found_articles), 'search_queries_used': targeted_queries, 'articles': found_articles, 'raw_search_results': search_results, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract specific nano-compound names', 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds (no plasmons)', 'found': len(found_articles), 'remaining': max(0, 23 - len(found_articles)) } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Articles data saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Now we need to access the full-text content of these {len(found_articles)} articles") print(f"to extract the specific nano-compound names from their:") print(f"- Abstract sections") print(f"- Methodology sections") print(f"- Results sections") print(f"\nThis will identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ARTICLES FOUND") print(f"The targeted search did not find Scientific Reports 2012 articles matching our criteria.") print(f"\nPossible reasons:") print(f"1. The articles may not be indexed by Google in the expected format") print(f"2. The search terms may need adjustment") print(f"3. The articles may require direct access to Nature.com") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE STRATEGIES:") print(f"1. Use the browsing URLs we identified earlier to scrape Nature.com directly") print(f"2. Try different search engines or academic databases") print(f"3. Access Nature.com Scientific Reports 2012 archive directly") # Save search attempt data anyway timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") search_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_search_attempt_{timestamp}.json' search_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search attempt', 'queries_attempted': targeted_queries, 'raw_search_results': search_results, 'articles_found': 0, 'issue': 'No matching articles found in search results', 'recommendations': [ 'Try web scraping Nature.com browsing pages', 'Use different search terms or engines', 'Access Nature.com archive directly' ] } with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Search attempt data saved to: {os.path.basename(search_file)}")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 16:56:10
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code ran but produced corrupted and irrelevant output. The initial inspection of workspace files and analysis data worked correctly, showing 2 high-priority browsing URLs for Scientific Reports 2012 articles. However, the targeted SerpAPI search section completely malfunctioned, producing garbled output containing unrelated Replit blog content instead of Scientific Reports articles. The output shows error messages like 'name 'page_text' is not defined' and content completely unrelated to the PLAN objectives. **PLAN** alignment: 25% - while the code correctly identified available browsing URLs from previous analysis, the core search functionality to find actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds failed catastrophically. The corrupted search results contain no usable information about Scientific Reports articles or nano-compounds. Recommended fix: Remove the corrupted SerpAPI search implementation and replace it with a clean, focused search specifically targeting nature.com/articles/srep URLs from 2012. Use the identified browsing URLs (nature.com/srep/articles?year=2012&page=3 and page=12) as the foundation for accessing actual research articles. The code should focus on extracting individual article URLs from these browsing pages to access the full-text content needed for nano-compound identification as specified in the PLAN.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from datetime import datetime import time # First, let's properly inspect what we have in workspace to understand our current data print("Inspecting workspace files to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Look for the most recent filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # Safely inspect the file structure first with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: try: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File loaded successfully") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Get basic info total_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles_found', 0) target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"Total target articles: {total_articles}") print(f"Articles list length: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f"Error loading JSON: {e}") target_articles = [] else: print("No filtered articles file found") target_articles = [] # Now let's implement a clean strategy to find actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"IMPLEMENTING TARGETED SEARCH FOR ACTUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) # Get API key api_key = os.getenv("SERPAPI_API_KEY") if api_key is None: print("‚ùå No SerpAPI key found. Cannot perform targeted search.") print("\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACH NEEDED:") print("Without API access, we would need to:") print("1. Use web scraping to access Nature.com browsing pages") print("2. Extract individual article URLs from those pages") print("3. Access each article's full content") print("4. Parse abstracts, methods, and results for nano-compound names") else: print("‚úÖ SerpAPI key found. Implementing targeted search strategy...") # Define very specific search queries for actual Scientific Reports articles # Focus on finding individual articles with specific nano-compound terms targeted_queries = [ 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanoparticle -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" graphene -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" "quantum dot" -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanotube carbon -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanowire -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanocrystal -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" fullerene -plasmon', 'site:nature.com/articles/srep "2012" nanocomposite -plasmon' ] print(f"\nExecuting {len(targeted_queries)} targeted searches...") found_articles = [] search_results = [] for i, query in enumerate(targeted_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(targeted_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 50) # Prepare search parameters params = { "q": query, "api_key": api_key, "engine": "google", "google_domain": "google.com", "safe": "off", "num": 15, # Get more results for better coverage "type": "search" } try: # Make API request with timeout response = requests.get("https://serpapi.com/search.json", params=params, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: results = response.json() # Store raw results search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'results': results.get('organic_results', []), 'search_number': i }) organic_results = results.get('organic_results', []) print(f"Found {len(organic_results)} results") # Filter for actual Scientific Reports articles for j, result in enumerate(organic_results, 1): title = result.get('title', '') link = result.get('link', '') snippet = result.get('snippet', '') print(f" {j}. {title[:60]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") # Check if this is an actual Scientific Reports article from 2012 is_srep_article = 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link has_2012 = '2012' in (title + snippet) has_nano_terms = any(term in (title + snippet).lower() for term in ['nano', 'quantum', 'graphene', 'carbon', 'fullerene']) no_plasmon = 'plasmon' not in (title + snippet).lower() print(f" ‚úì SREP article: {is_srep_article}") print(f" ‚úì Contains 2012: {has_2012}") print(f" ‚úì Nano terms: {has_nano_terms}") print(f" ‚úì No plasmon: {no_plasmon}") if is_srep_article and has_2012 and has_nano_terms and no_plasmon: # Extract nano terms found nano_terms_found = [] nano_keywords = ['nanoparticle', 'graphene', 'quantum dot', 'nanotube', 'nanowire', 'nanocrystal', 'fullerene', 'nanocomposite', 'carbon nanotube'] combined_text = (title + ' ' + snippet).lower() for keyword in nano_keywords: if keyword in combined_text: nano_terms_found.append(keyword) found_articles.append({ 'title': title, 'url': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'search_query': query, 'nano_terms_detected': nano_terms_found, 'article_id': len(found_articles) + 1 }) print(f" üéØ MATCH! Article #{len(found_articles)}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms_found)}") else: print(f" ‚ùå Not a target article") print() else: print(f"API error: Status {response.status_code}") search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'error': f'HTTP {response.status_code}', 'search_number': i }) except Exception as e: print(f"Search error: {str(e)}") search_results.append({ 'query': query, 'error': str(e), 'search_number': i }) # Small delay between requests to be respectful time.sleep(1) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä SEARCH STATISTICS:") print(f"Total searches executed: {len(targeted_queries)}") print(f"Successful searches: {len([r for r in search_results if 'error' not in r])}") print(f"Total articles found: {len(found_articles)}") if found_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-" * 60) for article in found_articles: print(f"\n{article['article_id']}. {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Nano-compounds: {', '.join(article['nano_terms_detected'])}") print(f" Snippet: {article['snippet'][:200]}...") # Save the found articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_target_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search for actual Scientific Reports 2012 articles', 'total_articles_found': len(found_articles), 'search_queries_used': targeted_queries, 'articles': found_articles, 'raw_search_results': search_results, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract specific nano-compound names', 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds (no plasmons)', 'found': len(found_articles), 'remaining': max(0, 23 - len(found_articles)) } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Articles data saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Now we need to access the full-text content of these {len(found_articles)} articles") print(f"to extract the specific nano-compound names from their:") print(f"- Abstract sections") print(f"- Methodology sections") print(f"- Results sections") print(f"\nThis will identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ARTICLES FOUND") print(f"The targeted search did not find Scientific Reports 2012 articles matching our criteria.") print(f"\nPossible reasons:") print(f"1. The articles may not be indexed by Google in the expected format") print(f"2. The search terms may need adjustment") print(f"3. The articles may require direct access to Nature.com") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE STRATEGIES:") print(f"1. Use the browsing URLs we identified earlier to scrape Nature.com directly") print(f"2. Try different search engines or academic databases") print(f"3. Access Nature.com Scientific Reports 2012 archive directly") # Save search attempt data anyway timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") search_file = f'workspace/scientific_reports_2012_search_attempt_{timestamp}.json' search_data = { 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_method': 'Targeted SerpAPI search attempt', 'queries_attempted': targeted_queries, 'raw_search_results': search_results, 'articles_found': 0, 'issue': 'No matching articles found in search results', 'recommendations': [ 'Try web scraping Nature.com browsing pages', 'Use different search terms or engines', 'Access Nature.com archive directly' ] } with open(search_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Search attempt data saved to: {os.path.basename(search_file)}")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 12)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered articles file to understand what we have print("Inspecting workspace to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure overview:") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Extract the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nTarget articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"Sample article title: {sample_article.get('title', 'No title')[:100]}...") print(f"Sample article URL: {sample_article.get('link', 'No URL')[:100]}...") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles to find actual research papers research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title[:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif 'nature.com/srep/articles' in link or 'nature.com/subjects' in link: browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä ARTICLE CATEGORIES:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") # Focus on actual research papers actual_papers = research_papers + external_papers if actual_papers: print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS IDENTIFIED: {len(actual_papers)}") print("-" * 60) for i, paper in enumerate(actual_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms detected: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") # Check if this appears to be from 2012 if '2012' in paper_snippet or '2012' in paper_title: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains 2012 reference") else: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è No clear 2012 reference found") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND") print(f"All 23 articles appear to be journal browsing pages or other content.") # Extract useful browsing URLs that might contain 2012 articles print(f"\nüìÇ BROWSING PAGES ANALYSIS:") print("-" * 60) useful_browsing_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_title = page.get('title', '') page_link = page.get('link', '') # Look for pages specifically about 2012 or that might contain 2012 articles if ('2012' in page_title or '2012' in page_link) and 'nature.com' in page_link: useful_browsing_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'type': '2012 articles page' }) print(f"\n üìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f" Type: Contains 2012 articles") print(f"\nFound {len(useful_browsing_urls)} useful browsing URLs for 2012 articles") # Assessment and strategy print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY FOR PLAN COMPLETION") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Target: 23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"- Actual research papers found: {len(actual_papers)}") print(f"- Browsing pages with 2012 content: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") print(f"- Main issue: Most results are journal navigation pages, not individual articles") print(f"\nüí° STRATEGY TO ACCESS ACTUAL ARTICLES:") print(f"Since we have browsing pages that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles,") print(f"we need to access these pages to extract individual article URLs.") if useful_browsing_urls: print(f"\nüîó PRIORITY BROWSING URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(useful_browsing_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. Access the browsing URLs to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to research papers (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_comprehensive_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { 'research_papers': len(research_papers), 'browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'assessment': { 'main_issue': 'Most results are journal browsing pages, not individual research articles', 'solution_needed': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs', 'target_articles_needed': 23 }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles', 'Extract direct links to Scientific Reports research papers', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The analysis clearly shows we need to access the browsing pages") print(f"to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"This will allow us to complete the PLAN by extracting specific") print(f"nano-compound names from the full-text content of each article.") else: print("No filtered articles file found in workspace")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 16:57:27
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 78 where 'link' is undefined in a generator expression. The code successfully loaded and analyzed the filtered articles file containing 23 target articles, properly categorized the first few articles (identifying them as journal browsing pages, subject category pages, etc.), and correctly diagnosed the core issue: most results are journal navigation pages rather than individual Scientific Reports 2012 research articles. However, execution crashed when processing article #3 due to a variable scoping error in the generator expression checking for external domains. **PLAN** alignment: 75% - the analysis approach is excellent and reveals crucial insights about needing actual research article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####) rather than browsing pages, but the categorization is incomplete due to the crash. The code identified 2 high-priority browsing URLs specifically for 2012 Scientific Reports articles, which is valuable for the next step. Recommended fix: Replace the undefined 'link' variable with 'article_link' in the generator expression on line 78, or use the properly scoped 'link' variable defined earlier in the loop. The diagnostic strategy is sound and shows we need to access individual research papers to extract specific nano-compound names from their abstracts, methodology, and results sections as required by the PLAN.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered articles file to understand what we have print("Inspecting workspace to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure overview:") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Extract the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nTarget articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"Sample article title: {sample_article.get('title', 'No title')[:100]}...") print(f"Sample article URL: {sample_article.get('link', 'No URL')[:100]}...") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles to find actual research papers research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title[:80]}...") print(f" URL: {link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif 'nature.com/srep/articles' in link or 'nature.com/subjects' in link: browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä ARTICLE CATEGORIES:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") # Access the browsing URLs to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to research papers (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_comprehensive_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { 'research_papers': len(research_papers), 'browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'assessment': { 'main_issue': 'Most results are journal browsing pages, not individual research articles', 'solution_needed': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs', 'target_articles_needed': 23 }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles', 'Extract direct links to Scientific Reports research papers', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The analysis clearly shows we need to access the browsing pages") print(f"to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"This will allow us to complete the PLAN by extracting specific") print(f"nano-compound names from the full-text content of each article.") else: print("No filtered articles file found in workspace")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered articles file to understand what we have print("Inspecting workspace to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure overview:") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Extract the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nTarget articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"Sample article title: {sample_article.get('title', 'No title')[:100]}...") print(f"Sample article URL: {sample_article.get('link', 'No URL')[:100]}...") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles to find actual research papers research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables at the beginning to avoid scope issues title = article.get('title', '') article_link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title[:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns - using properly scoped variables if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in article_link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif 'nature.com/srep/articles' in article_link or 'nature.com/subjects' in article_link: browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in article_link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä ARTICLE CATEGORIES:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") # Focus on actual research papers actual_papers = research_papers + external_papers if actual_papers: print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS IDENTIFIED: {len(actual_papers)}") print("-" * 60) for i, paper in enumerate(actual_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms detected: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:200]}...") # Check if this appears to be from 2012 if '2012' in paper_snippet or '2012' in paper_title: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains 2012 reference") else: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è No clear 2012 reference found") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND") print(f"All 23 articles appear to be journal browsing pages or other content.") # Extract useful browsing URLs that might contain 2012 articles print(f"\nüìÇ BROWSING PAGES ANALYSIS:") print("-" * 60) useful_browsing_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_title = page.get('title', '') page_link = page.get('link', '') # Look for pages specifically about 2012 or that might contain 2012 articles if ('2012' in page_title or '2012' in page_link) and 'nature.com' in page_link: useful_browsing_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'type': '2012 articles page' }) print(f"\n üìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f" Type: Contains 2012 articles") print(f"\nFound {len(useful_browsing_urls)} useful browsing URLs for 2012 articles") # Assessment and strategy print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY FOR PLAN COMPLETION") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Target: 23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"- Actual research papers found: {len(actual_papers)}") print(f"- Browsing pages with 2012 content: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") print(f"- Main issue: Most results are journal navigation pages, not individual articles") print(f"\nüí° STRATEGY TO ACCESS ACTUAL ARTICLES:") print(f"Since we have browsing pages that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles,") print(f"we need to access these pages to extract individual article URLs.") if useful_browsing_urls: print(f"\nüîó PRIORITY BROWSING URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(useful_browsing_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. Access the browsing URLs to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to research papers (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_comprehensive_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { 'research_papers': len(research_papers), 'browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'assessment': { 'main_issue': 'Most results are journal browsing pages, not individual research articles', 'solution_needed': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs', 'target_articles_needed': 23 }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles', 'Extract direct links to Scientific Reports research papers', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The analysis clearly shows we need to access the browsing pages") print(f"to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"This will allow us to complete the PLAN by extracting specific") print(f"nano-compound names from the full-text content of each article.") else: print("No filtered articles file found in workspace")
