Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's properly inspect the filtered articles file to understand what we have print("Inspecting workspace to understand current data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if filtered_files: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nInspecting filtered articles file: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # First, inspect the file structure safely with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print(f"File structure overview:") for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:100]}...") # Extract the target articles target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nTarget articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if target_articles: sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article structure: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"Sample article title: {sample_article.get('title', 'No title')[:100]}...") print(f"Sample article URL: {sample_article.get('link', 'No URL')[:100]}...") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ARTICLES TO IDENTIFY ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize articles to find actual research papers research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Extract all variables at the beginning to avoid scope issues title = article.get('title', '') article_link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {title[:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns - using properly scoped variables if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in article_link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif 'nature.com/srep/articles' in article_link or 'nature.com/subjects' in article_link: browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in article_link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä ARTICLE CATEGORIES:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {len(target_articles)}") # Check if this appears to be from 2012 if '2012' in paper_snippet or '2012' in paper_title: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains 2012 reference") else: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è No clear 2012 reference found") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND") print(f"All 23 articles appear to be journal browsing pages or other content.") # Extract useful browsing URLs that might contain 2012 articles print(f"\nüìÇ BROWSING PAGES ANALYSIS:") print("-" * 60) useful_browsing_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_title = page.get('title', '') page_link = page.get('link', '') # Look for pages specifically about 2012 or that might contain 2012 articles if ('2012' in page_title or '2012' in page_link) and 'nature.com' in page_link: useful_browsing_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'type': '2012 articles page' }) print(f"\n üìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f" Type: Contains 2012 articles") print(f"\nFound {len(useful_browsing_urls)} useful browsing URLs for 2012 articles") # Assessment and strategy print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ASSESSMENT AND STRATEGY FOR PLAN COMPLETION") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ CURRENT SITUATION:") print(f"- Target: 23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"- Actual research papers found: {len(actual_papers)}") print(f"- Browsing pages with 2012 content: {len(useful_browsing_urls)}") print(f"- Main issue: Most results are journal navigation pages, not individual articles") print(f"\nüí° STRATEGY TO ACCESS ACTUAL ARTICLES:") print(f"Since we have browsing pages that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles,") print(f"we need to access these pages to extract individual article URLs.") if useful_browsing_urls: print(f"\nüîó PRIORITY BROWSING URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(useful_browsing_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. Access the browsing URLs to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"2. Extract direct links to research papers (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. Access full-text content of each article") print(f"4. Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/article_analysis_comprehensive_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization': { 'research_papers': len(research_papers), 'browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'useful_browsing_urls': useful_browsing_urls, 'assessment': { 'main_issue': 'Most results are journal browsing pages, not individual research articles', 'solution_needed': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs', 'target_articles_needed': 23 }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access browsing URLs to find individual 2012 articles', 'Extract direct links to Scientific Reports research papers', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Comprehensive analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The analysis clearly shows we need to access the browsing pages") print(f"to find individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"This will allow us to complete the PLAN by extracting specific") print(f"nano-compound names from the full-text content of each article.") else: print("No filtered articles file found in workspace")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's safely inspect the workspace and understand the file structure print("Inspecting workspace files and data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if not filtered_files: print("\n‚ùå No filtered articles file found") else: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nüìÑ Inspecting: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # Safely inspect file structure first try: with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print("‚úÖ File loaded successfully") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key safely for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys - {list(value.keys())[:3]}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading file: {e}") filtered_data = None if filtered_data: # Extract target articles safely target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if not target_articles: print("‚ùå No target articles in the data") else: # Show sample article structure sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ALL {len(target_articles)} ARTICLES FOR RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize all articles safely research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Safely extract all needed data first try: title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i:2d}. {title[:70]}...") print(f" URL: {link[:80]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms) if nano_terms else 'None'}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:120]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif ('nature.com/srep/articles' in link or 'nature.com/subjects' in link): browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov', 'pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error processing article {i}: {e}") other_content.append(article) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION COMPLETE") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä FINAL CATEGORIZATION RESULTS:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles processed: {len(target_articles)}") # Analyze actual research papers found actual_papers = research_papers + external_papers if actual_papers: print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS IDENTIFIED: {len(actual_papers)}") print("-" * 60) for i, paper in enumerate(actual_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:150]}...") # Check for 2012 reference if '2012' in paper_snippet or '2012' in paper_title: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains 2012 reference") else: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è No clear 2012 reference") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND") print(f"All {len(target_articles)} articles are browsing pages or other content.") # Extract high-priority browsing URLs for 2012 articles print(f"\nüìÇ BROWSING PAGES WITH 2012 CONTENT:") print("-" * 60) priority_2012_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_title = page.get('title', '') page_link = page.get('link', '') page_snippet = page.get('snippet', '') # Look for 2012-specific browsing pages if (('2012' in page_title or '2012' in page_link or '2012' in page_snippet) and 'nature.com' in page_link): priority_2012_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'snippet': page_snippet, 'type': '2012 Scientific Reports browsing page' }) print(f"\nüìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f" Type: Contains 2012 articles") print(f" Snippet: {page_snippet[:100]}...") print(f"\nFound {len(priority_2012_urls)} high-priority browsing URLs for 2012 articles") # Assessment and next steps print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"PLAN STATUS AND NEXT STEPS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ CURRENT STATUS:") print(f"- PLAN Target: 23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"- Actual research papers found: {len(actual_papers)}") print(f"- High-priority 2012 browsing pages: {len(priority_2012_urls)}") print(f"- Main finding: Most 'target articles' are journal navigation pages") print(f"\nüí° STRATEGY TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"Since we have {len(priority_2012_urls)} browsing pages that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles,") print(f"we need to access these pages to extract individual article URLs.") if priority_2012_urls: print(f"\nüîó HIGH-PRIORITY URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_2012_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") print(f" Expected content: Individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"\nüìã REQUIRED NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"1. üåê Access the high-priority browsing URLs") print(f"2. üîç Extract individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. üìÑ Access full-text content of each 2012 article") print(f"4. üî¨ Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. üéØ Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/final_article_analysis_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization_results': { 'scientific_reports_research_papers': len(research_papers), 'journal_browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_research_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'priority_2012_browsing_urls': priority_2012_urls, 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'current_research_papers_found': len(actual_papers), 'browsing_pages_with_2012_content': len(priority_2012_urls), 'main_issue': 'Target articles are mostly journal navigation pages, not individual research papers', 'solution': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs' }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access high-priority browsing URLs', 'Extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 article URLs', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results', 'Identify target nano-compound from TASK' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ ANALYSIS COMPLETE - READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The comprehensive analysis reveals we have {len(priority_2012_urls)} high-priority") print(f"browsing URLs that contain Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"Accessing these pages will allow us to find the individual research papers") print(f"needed to complete the PLAN by extracting specific nano-compound names.")

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed a comprehensive analysis of the 23 target articles from the filtered dataset. The analysis successfully categorized all articles and revealed the core issue: 0 actual Scientific Reports research papers were found, while 10 articles are journal browsing/category pages and 13 are other content. The code correctly identified that most 'target articles' are Nature.com navigation pages rather than individual research papers with URLs like nature.com/articles/srep#####. **PLAN** alignment: 85% complete - the analysis provides crucial insights and identifies 10 high-priority browsing URLs that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles studying nano-compounds. The comprehensive output saved to 'final_article_analysis_20250806_170240.json' contains the complete categorization and strategy for accessing actual research papers. Next step clearly defined: access the 10 browsing URLs to extract individual article URLs, then access full-text content to extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results sections. The analysis successfully bridges the gap between having journal browsing pages and needing actual research articles to complete the nano-compound identification task specified in the PLAN.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's safely inspect the workspace and understand the file structure print("Inspecting workspace files and data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") # Find the filtered articles file filtered_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'scientific_reports_2012_filtered_articles' in f] if not filtered_files: print("\n‚ùå No filtered articles file found") else: latest_filtered = sorted(filtered_files)[-1] filtered_path = f'workspace/{latest_filtered}' print(f"\nüìÑ Inspecting: {latest_filtered}") print("-" * 60) # Safely inspect file structure first try: with open(filtered_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: filtered_data = json.load(f) print("‚úÖ File loaded successfully") print(f"Top-level keys: {list(filtered_data.keys())}") # Inspect each key safely for key, value in filtered_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" {key}: list with {len(value)} items") if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f" Sample item keys: {list(value[0].keys())}") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys - {list(value.keys())[:3]}...") else: print(f" {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error loading file: {e}") filtered_data = None if filtered_data: # Extract target articles safely target_articles = filtered_data.get('target_articles', []) print(f"\nüìä Target articles found: {len(target_articles)}") if not target_articles: print("‚ùå No target articles in the data") else: # Show sample article structure sample_article = target_articles[0] print(f"Sample article keys: {list(sample_article.keys())}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ANALYZING ALL {len(target_articles)} ARTICLES FOR RESEARCH PAPERS") print(f"=" * 80) # Categorize all articles safely research_papers = [] browsing_pages = [] external_papers = [] other_content = [] for i, article in enumerate(target_articles, 1): # Safely extract all needed data first try: title = article.get('title', '') link = article.get('link', '') snippet = article.get('snippet', '') nano_terms = article.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i:2d}. {title[:70]}...") print(f" URL: {link[:80]}...") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(nano_terms) if nano_terms else 'None'}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:120]}...") # Categorize based on URL patterns if 'nature.com/articles/srep' in link: research_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: Scientific Reports research paper") elif ('nature.com/srep/articles' in link or 'nature.com/subjects' in link): browsing_pages.append(article) print(f" üìÇ Category: Journal browsing/category page") elif any(domain in link for domain in ['pubs.acs.org', 'pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov', 'pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov']): external_papers.append(article) print(f" üìÑ Category: External research paper") else: other_content.append(article) print(f" üåê Category: Other content") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error processing article {i}: {e}") other_content.append(article) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"CATEGORIZATION COMPLETE") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüìä FINAL CATEGORIZATION RESULTS:") print(f"- Scientific Reports research papers: {len(research_papers)}") print(f"- Journal browsing/category pages: {len(browsing_pages)}") print(f"- External research papers: {len(external_papers)}") print(f"- Other content: {len(other_content)}") print(f"- Total articles processed: {len(target_articles)}") # Analyze actual research papers found actual_papers = research_papers + external_papers if actual_papers: print(f"\nüìÑ ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS IDENTIFIED: {len(actual_papers)}") print("-" * 60) for i, paper in enumerate(actual_papers, 1): paper_title = paper.get('title', '') paper_link = paper.get('link', '') paper_snippet = paper.get('snippet', '') paper_nano_terms = paper.get('matching_nano_terms', []) print(f"\n{i}. {paper_title}") print(f" URL: {paper_link}") print(f" Nano terms: {', '.join(paper_nano_terms)}") print(f" Snippet: {paper_snippet[:150]}...") # Check for 2012 reference if '2012' in paper_snippet or '2012' in paper_title: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains 2012 reference") else: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è No clear 2012 reference") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO ACTUAL RESEARCH PAPERS FOUND") print(f"All {len(target_articles)} articles are browsing pages or other content.") # Extract high-priority browsing URLs for 2012 articles print(f"\nüìÇ BROWSING PAGES WITH 2012 CONTENT:") print("-" * 60) priority_2012_urls = [] for page in browsing_pages: page_title = page.get('title', '') page_link = page.get('link', '') page_snippet = page.get('snippet', '') # Look for 2012-specific browsing pages if (('2012' in page_title or '2012' in page_link or '2012' in page_snippet) and 'nature.com' in page_link): priority_2012_urls.append({ 'title': page_title, 'url': page_link, 'snippet': page_snippet, 'type': '2012 Scientific Reports browsing page' }) print(f"\nüìã {page_title}") print(f" {page_link}") print(f" Type: Contains 2012 articles") print(f" Snippet: {page_snippet[:100]}...") print(f"\nFound {len(priority_2012_urls)} high-priority browsing URLs for 2012 articles") # Assessment and next steps print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"PLAN STATUS AND NEXT STEPS") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ CURRENT STATUS:") print(f"- PLAN Target: 23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds") print(f"- Actual research papers found: {len(actual_papers)}") print(f"- High-priority 2012 browsing pages: {len(priority_2012_urls)}") print(f"- Main finding: Most 'target articles' are journal navigation pages") print(f"\nüí° STRATEGY TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"Since we have {len(priority_2012_urls)} browsing pages that contain 2012 Scientific Reports articles,") print(f"we need to access these pages to extract individual article URLs.") if priority_2012_urls: print(f"\nüîó HIGH-PRIORITY URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_2012_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" {url_info['url']}") print(f" Expected content: Individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles") print(f"\nüìã REQUIRED NEXT STEPS FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"1. üåê Access the high-priority browsing URLs") print(f"2. üîç Extract individual article URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. üìÑ Access full-text content of each 2012 article") print(f"4. üî¨ Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. üéØ Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save comprehensive analysis timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") analysis_file = f'workspace/final_article_analysis_{timestamp}.json' analysis_data = { 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_file': latest_filtered, 'total_articles_analyzed': len(target_articles), 'categorization_results': { 'scientific_reports_research_papers': len(research_papers), 'journal_browsing_pages': len(browsing_pages), 'external_research_papers': len(external_papers), 'other_content': len(other_content) }, 'actual_research_papers': actual_papers, 'priority_2012_browsing_urls': priority_2012_urls, 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'current_research_papers_found': len(actual_papers), 'browsing_pages_with_2012_content': len(priority_2012_urls), 'main_issue': 'Target articles are mostly journal navigation pages, not individual research papers', 'solution': 'Access browsing pages to extract individual article URLs' }, 'next_steps': [ 'Access high-priority browsing URLs', 'Extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 article URLs', 'Access full-text content of each article', 'Extract nano-compound names from abstracts, methods, results', 'Identify target nano-compound from TASK' ] } with open(analysis_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Complete analysis saved to: {os.path.basename(analysis_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ ANALYSIS COMPLETE - READY FOR NEXT PHASE:") print(f"The comprehensive analysis reveals we have {len(priority_2012_urls)} high-priority") print(f"browsing URLs that contain Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"Accessing these pages will allow us to find the individual research papers") print(f"needed to complete the PLAN by extracting specific nano-compound names.")

Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time # First, let's inspect the final analysis file to understand our priority URLs print("Accessing browsing pages to extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("="*80) # Load the final analysis file to get priority URLs analysis_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if 'final_article_analysis' in f] if not analysis_files: print("‚ùå No final analysis file found") else: latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"üìÑ Loading analysis file: {latest_analysis}") with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_2012_browsing_urls', []) print(f"Found {len(priority_urls)} priority browsing URLs") if not priority_urls: print("‚ùå No priority URLs found in analysis") else: # Select the most promising URLs for accessing individual articles # Focus on the ones that specifically mention 2012 and have clear article listings target_urls = [ { 'title': 'Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports (Page 3)', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/srep/articles?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&year=2012&page=3', 'priority': 'HIGH - Specifically filtered for 2012 articles' }, { 'title': 'Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports (Page 12)', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/srep/articles?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&year=2012&page=12', 'priority': 'HIGH - Specifically filtered for 2012 articles' }, { 'title': 'Nanoparticles articles within Scientific Reports', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/subjects/nanoparticles/srep?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&page=40', 'priority': 'MEDIUM - Nanoparticles focus with 2012 content' }, { 'title': 'Nanoscale materials articles within Scientific Reports', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/subjects/nanoscale-materials/srep?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&page=133', 'priority': 'MEDIUM - Nanoscale materials with 2012 content' } ] print(f"\nüéØ TARGETING {len(target_urls)} MOST PROMISING BROWSING PAGES:") for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" URL: {url_info['url']}") print(f" Priority: {url_info['priority']}") print() # Now access these pages to extract individual article URLs print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"ACCESSING BROWSING PAGES TO EXTRACT INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"="*80) individual_articles = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}/{len(target_urls)}: {url_info['title']}") print(f"URL: {url_info['url']}") print("-"*60) try: # Add headers to mimic a real browser headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Make request with timeout response = requests.get(url_info['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed page (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for individual article links in Scientific Reports format # These typically have URLs like: /articles/srep##### or nature.com/articles/srep##### article_links = [] # Find all links that match Scientific Reports article pattern for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') if href and ('/articles/srep' in href or '/articles/s41598' in href): # Convert relative URLs to absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = 'https://www.nature.com' + href else: full_url = href # Extract article title if available article_title = link.get_text().strip() or 'No title found' article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'title': article_title, 'source_page': url_info['title'] }) # Remove duplicates based on URL unique_articles = {} for article in article_links: if article['url'] not in unique_articles: unique_articles[article['url']] = article page_articles = list(unique_articles.values()) print(f"üìÑ Found {len(page_articles)} individual articles on this page") # Show first few articles found for j, article in enumerate(page_articles[:5], 1): print(f" {j}. {article['title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") if len(page_articles) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(page_articles) - 5} more articles") # Add to our collection individual_articles.extend(page_articles) else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing page: {str(e)}") # Small delay between requests to be respectful if i < len(target_urls): time.sleep(2) print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTION SUMMARY") print(f"="*80) # Remove duplicates from the final collection final_unique_articles = {} for article in individual_articles: if article['url'] not in final_unique_articles: final_unique_articles[article['url']] = article final_articles = list(final_unique_articles.values()) print(f"\nüìä EXTRACTION RESULTS:") print(f"- Total browsing pages accessed: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"- Individual articles found: {len(final_articles)}") print(f"- Unique articles after deduplication: {len(final_articles)}") if final_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ INDIVIDUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-"*60) for i, article in enumerate(final_articles[:15], 1): # Show first 15 print(f"\n{i:2d}. {article['title'][:100]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Source: {article['source_page']}") if len(final_articles) > 15: print(f"\n ... and {len(final_articles) - 15} more articles") # Save the extracted articles for the next step timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/individual_scientific_reports_2012_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'extraction_method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'browsing_pages_accessed': len(target_urls), 'total_articles_found': len(final_articles), 'target_urls_accessed': target_urls, 'individual_articles': final_articles, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract nano-compound names', 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'articles_found': len(final_articles), 'ready_for_content_analysis': True } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Individual articles data saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Now we have {len(final_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles.") print(f"Next, we need to access the full-text content of each article to extract:") print(f"- Specific nano-compound names from abstracts") print(f"- Methodology sections describing the nano-compounds") print(f"- Results sections with nano-compound analysis") print(f"\nThis will allow us to identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES FOUND") print(f"The browsing pages may not have contained the expected article links.") print(f"\nPossible issues:") print(f"- Pages may require JavaScript to load content") print(f"- Article links may use different URL patterns") print(f"- Pages may have anti-scraping measures") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Try different URL patterns for article extraction") print(f"2. Use selenium for JavaScript-rendered content") print(f"3. Access Nature.com API if available") print(f"4. Try direct search for specific nano-compound terms")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - The code output is completely corrupted and unrelated to the PLAN objectives. The code was supposed to access browsing pages to extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles, but instead produced garbled output containing unrelated content about Replit blog posts, CodeMirror editors, and video streaming services. The output shows error messages and content completely irrelevant to Scientific Reports articles or nano-compounds. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - the code failed to access any of the identified browsing URLs (nature.com/srep/articles?year=2012&page=3, etc.) and produced no usable information about Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds. The corrupted output suggests either a major execution error or the wrong code was run. The HISTORY shows we had successfully identified 10 high-priority browsing URLs containing 2012 Scientific Reports articles, but this execution completely failed to utilize that progress. Recommended fix: Implement a clean, focused web scraping approach to access the specific Nature.com browsing URLs identified in the previous analysis (saved in final_article_analysis_20250806_170240.json). The code should extract individual article URLs with the pattern nature.com/articles/srep##### from those browsing pages to access the actual research papers needed for nano-compound identification.
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time # First, let's inspect the final analysis file to understand our priority URLs print("Accessing browsing pages to extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles...") print("="*80) # Load the final analysis file to get priority URLs analysis_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if 'final_article_analysis' in f] if not analysis_files: print("‚ùå No final analysis file found") else: latest_analysis = sorted(analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"üìÑ Loading analysis file: {latest_analysis}") with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: analysis_data = json.load(f) priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_2012_browsing_urls', []) print(f"Found {len(priority_urls)} priority browsing URLs") if not priority_urls: print("‚ùå No priority URLs found in analysis") else: # Select the most promising URLs for accessing individual articles # Focus on the ones that specifically mention 2012 and have clear article listings target_urls = [ { 'title': 'Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports (Page 3)', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/srep/articles?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&year=2012&page=3', 'priority': 'HIGH - Specifically filtered for 2012 articles' }, { 'title': 'Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports (Page 12)', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/srep/articles?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&year=2012&page=12', 'priority': 'HIGH - Specifically filtered for 2012 articles' }, { 'title': 'Nanoparticles articles within Scientific Reports', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/subjects/nanoparticles/srep?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&page=40', 'priority': 'MEDIUM - Nanoparticles focus with 2012 content' }, { 'title': 'Nanoscale materials articles within Scientific Reports', 'url': 'https://www.nature.com/subjects/nanoscale-materials/srep?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&page=133', 'priority': 'MEDIUM - Nanoscale materials with 2012 content' } ] print(f"\nüéØ TARGETING {len(target_urls)} MOST PROMISING BROWSING PAGES:") for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f" {i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" URL: {url_info['url']}") print(f" Priority: {url_info['priority']}") print() # Now access these pages to extract individual article URLs print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"ACCESSING BROWSING PAGES TO EXTRACT INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"="*80) individual_articles = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}/{len(target_urls)}: {url_info['title']}") print(f"URL: {url_info['url']}") print("-"*60) try: # Add headers to mimic a real browser headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Make request with timeout response = requests.get(url_info['url'], headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed page (Status: {response.status_code})") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Look for individual article links in Scientific Reports format # These typically have URLs like: /articles/srep##### or nature.com/articles/srep##### article_links = [] # Find all links that match Scientific Reports article pattern for link in soup.find_all('a', href=True): href = link.get('href') if href and ('/articles/srep' in href or '/articles/s41598' in href): # Convert relative URLs to absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = 'https://www.nature.com' + href else: full_url = href # Extract article title if available article_title = link.get_text().strip() or 'No title found' article_links.append({ 'url': full_url, 'title': article_title, 'source_page': url_info['title'] }) # Remove duplicates based on URL unique_articles = {} for article in article_links: if article['url'] not in unique_articles: unique_articles[article['url']] = article page_articles = list(unique_articles.values()) print(f"üìÑ Found {len(page_articles)} individual articles on this page") # Show first few articles found for j, article in enumerate(page_articles[:5], 1): print(f" {j}. {article['title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") if len(page_articles) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(page_articles) - 5} more articles") # Add to our collection individual_articles.extend(page_articles) else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access page (Status: {response.status_code})") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing page: {str(e)}") # Small delay between requests to be respectful if i < len(target_urls): time.sleep(2) print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTION SUMMARY") print(f"="*80) # Remove duplicates from the final collection final_unique_articles = {} for article in individual_articles: if article['url'] not in final_unique_articles: final_unique_articles[article['url']] = article final_articles = list(final_unique_articles.values()) print(f"\nüìä EXTRACTION RESULTS:") print(f"- Total browsing pages accessed: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"- Individual articles found: {len(final_articles)}") print(f"- Unique articles after deduplication: {len(final_articles)}") if final_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ INDIVIDUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-"*60) for i, article in enumerate(final_articles[:15], 1): # Show first 15 print(f"\n{i:2d}. {article['title'][:100]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Source: {article['source_page']}") if len(final_articles) > 15: print(f"\n ... and {len(final_articles) - 15} more articles") # Save the extracted articles for the next step timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/individual_scientific_reports_2012_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'extraction_method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'browsing_pages_accessed': len(target_urls), 'total_articles_found': len(final_articles), 'target_urls_accessed': target_urls, 'individual_articles': final_articles, 'next_step': 'Access full-text content of each article to extract nano-compound names', 'plan_status': { 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'articles_found': len(final_articles), 'ready_for_content_analysis': True } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Individual articles data saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ NEXT STEP FOR PLAN COMPLETION:") print(f"Now we have {len(final_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles.") print(f"Next, we need to access the full-text content of each article to extract:") print(f"- Specific nano-compound names from abstracts") print(f"- Methodology sections describing the nano-compounds") print(f"- Results sections with nano-compound analysis") print(f"\nThis will allow us to identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è NO INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES FOUND") print(f"The browsing pages may not have contained the expected article links.") print(f"\nPossible issues:") print(f"- Pages may require JavaScript to load content") print(f"- Article links may use different URL patterns") print(f"- Pages may have anti-scraping measures") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Try different URL patterns for article extraction") print(f"2. Use selenium for JavaScript-rendered content") print(f"3. Access Nature.com API if available") print(f"4. Try direct search for specific nano-compound terms")

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have and their structure print("Inspecting workspace for analysis files and understanding data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"üìÅ Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") # Group files by type for better understanding analysis_files = [] search_files = [] other_files = [] for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") if 'analysis' in file.lower(): analysis_files.append(file) elif 'search' in file.lower() or 'scientific_reports' in file.lower(): search_files.append(file) else: other_files.append(file) print(f"\nüìä File categorization:") print(f"- Analysis files: {len(analysis_files)}") print(f"- Search/Scientific Reports files: {len(search_files)}") print(f"- Other files: {len(other_files)}") # Find the most recent final analysis file final_analysis_files = [f for f in analysis_files if 'final_article_analysis' in f] if final_analysis_files: latest_analysis = sorted(final_analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nüéØ Inspecting latest analysis file: {latest_analysis}") print("-" * 60) # SAFELY inspect the file structure first try: with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: file_content = f.read() print(f"‚úÖ File loaded successfully, size: {len(file_content)} characters") # Parse JSON safely analysis_data = json.loads(file_content) print(f"‚úÖ JSON parsed successfully") # Inspect top-level structure print(f"\nüìã Top-level keys in analysis file:") for key in analysis_data.keys(): value = analysis_data[key] if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error inspecting analysis file: {e}") analysis_data = None if analysis_data: # Extract the priority browsing URLs from the analysis priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_2012_browsing_urls', []) print(f"\nüîó Priority browsing URLs found: {len(priority_urls)}") if priority_urls: print(f"\nüìÑ PRIORITY URLS STRUCTURE INSPECTION:") sample_url = priority_urls[0] print(f"Sample URL structure: {list(sample_url.keys()) if isinstance(sample_url, dict) else 'Not a dict'}") # Display all priority URLs print(f"\nüéØ ALL {len(priority_urls)} PRIORITY BROWSING URLS:") print("-" * 60) target_urls_for_extraction = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): if isinstance(url_info, dict): title = url_info.get('title', 'No title') url = url_info.get('url', 'No URL') url_type = url_info.get('type', 'No type') snippet = url_info.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i:2d}. {title}") print(f" URL: {url}") print(f" Type: {url_type}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}...") # Identify the most promising URLs for article extraction if '2012' in url and 'nature.com' in url: priority_level = 'HIGH' if 'year=2012' in url else 'MEDIUM' target_urls_for_extraction.append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'priority': priority_level, 'expected_content': 'Scientific Reports 2012 articles' }) else: print(f"{i:2d}. Invalid URL structure: {url_info}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"STRATEGY FOR ACCESSING INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ IDENTIFIED {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} TARGET URLS FOR EXTRACTION:") if target_urls_for_extraction: for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls_for_extraction, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" URL: {url_info['url']}") print(f" Priority: {url_info['priority']}") print(f" Expected: {url_info['expected_content']}") print(f"\nüí° NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. üåê Access these {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} browsing URLs") print(f"2. üîç Extract individual article URLs (pattern: nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. üìÑ Access full-text content of each 2012 article") print(f"4. üî¨ Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. üéØ Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save the target URLs for the next extraction step timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") target_urls_file = f'workspace/target_browsing_urls_for_extraction_{timestamp}.json' target_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_analysis_file': latest_analysis, 'total_priority_urls': len(priority_urls), 'target_urls_selected': len(target_urls_for_extraction), 'target_urls': target_urls_for_extraction, 'extraction_strategy': { 'method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'target_pattern': 'nature.com/articles/srep##### or /articles/s41598', 'focus': 'Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'goal': 'Extract individual article URLs for full-text analysis' }, 'plan_status': { 'current_phase': 'Ready to extract individual article URLs', 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'next_step': 'Access browsing pages and extract individual articles' } } with open(target_urls_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(target_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Target URLs saved to: {os.path.basename(target_urls_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR ARTICLE EXTRACTION PHASE:") print(f"We have successfully identified {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} high-priority") print(f"browsing URLs that contain Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"The next step is to access these pages and extract individual article URLs") print(f"to complete the PLAN requirement of analyzing full-text content.") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No suitable target URLs identified for extraction") print(f"The priority URLs may not contain the expected 2012 article listings") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No priority browsing URLs found in the analysis file") print(f"May need to re-run the analysis to identify browsing pages") else: print(f"‚ùå No final analysis files found") print(f"Available analysis files: {analysis_files}") print(f"Need to run the article analysis step first")
Execution Output

Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports URL: https://www.nature.com/srep/articles?searchType=journalSearch&sort=PubDate&year=2012&page=3 Priority: HIGH Expected: Scientific Reports 2012 articles 2. Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have and their structure print("Inspecting workspace for analysis files and understanding data structure...") print("=" * 80) if not os.path.exists('workspace'): print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") else: workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f"üìÅ Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace:") # Group files by type for better understanding analysis_files = [] search_files = [] other_files = [] for file in sorted(workspace_files): print(f" - {file}") if 'analysis' in file.lower(): analysis_files.append(file) elif 'search' in file.lower() or 'scientific_reports' in file.lower(): search_files.append(file) else: other_files.append(file) print(f"\nüìä File categorization:") print(f"- Analysis files: {len(analysis_files)}") print(f"- Search/Scientific Reports files: {len(search_files)}") print(f"- Other files: {len(other_files)}") # Find the most recent final analysis file final_analysis_files = [f for f in analysis_files if 'final_article_analysis' in f] if final_analysis_files: latest_analysis = sorted(final_analysis_files)[-1] analysis_path = f'workspace/{latest_analysis}' print(f"\nüéØ Inspecting latest analysis file: {latest_analysis}") print("-" * 60) # SAFELY inspect the file structure first try: with open(analysis_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: file_content = f.read() print(f"‚úÖ File loaded successfully, size: {len(file_content)} characters") # Parse JSON safely analysis_data = json.loads(file_content) print(f"‚úÖ JSON parsed successfully") # Inspect top-level structure print(f"\nüìã Top-level keys in analysis file:") for key in analysis_data.keys(): value = analysis_data[key] if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error inspecting analysis file: {e}") analysis_data = None if analysis_data: # Extract the priority browsing URLs from the analysis priority_urls = analysis_data.get('priority_2012_browsing_urls', []) print(f"\nüîó Priority browsing URLs found: {len(priority_urls)}") if priority_urls: print(f"\nüìÑ PRIORITY URLS STRUCTURE INSPECTION:") sample_url = priority_urls[0] print(f"Sample URL structure: {list(sample_url.keys()) if isinstance(sample_url, dict) else 'Not a dict'}") # Display all priority URLs print(f"\nüéØ ALL {len(priority_urls)} PRIORITY BROWSING URLS:") print("-" * 60) target_urls_for_extraction = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(priority_urls, 1): if isinstance(url_info, dict): title = url_info.get('title', 'No title') url = url_info.get('url', 'No URL') url_type = url_info.get('type', 'No type') snippet = url_info.get('snippet', 'No snippet') print(f"\n{i:2d}. {title}") print(f" URL: {url}") print(f" Type: {url_type}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}...") # Identify the most promising URLs for article extraction if '2012' in url and 'nature.com' in url: priority_level = 'HIGH' if 'year=2012' in url else 'MEDIUM' target_urls_for_extraction.append({ 'title': title, 'url': url, 'priority': priority_level, 'expected_content': 'Scientific Reports 2012 articles' }) else: print(f"{i:2d}. Invalid URL structure: {url_info}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"STRATEGY FOR ACCESSING INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) print(f"\nüéØ IDENTIFIED {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} TARGET URLS FOR EXTRACTION:") if target_urls_for_extraction: for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls_for_extraction, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {url_info['title']}") print(f" URL: {url_info['url']}") print(f" Priority: {url_info['priority']}") print(f" Expected: {url_info['expected_content']}") print(f"\nüí° NEXT STEPS TO COMPLETE THE PLAN:") print(f"1. üåê Access these {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} browsing URLs") print(f"2. üîç Extract individual article URLs (pattern: nature.com/articles/srep#####)") print(f"3. üìÑ Access full-text content of each 2012 article") print(f"4. üî¨ Extract specific nano-compound names from:") print(f" - Abstract sections") print(f" - Methodology sections") print(f" - Results sections") print(f"5. üéØ Identify the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK") # Save the target URLs for the next extraction step timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") target_urls_file = f'workspace/target_browsing_urls_for_extraction_{timestamp}.json' target_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'source_analysis_file': latest_analysis, 'total_priority_urls': len(priority_urls), 'target_urls_selected': len(target_urls_for_extraction), 'target_urls': target_urls_for_extraction, 'extraction_strategy': { 'method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'target_pattern': 'nature.com/articles/srep##### or /articles/s41598', 'focus': 'Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'goal': 'Extract individual article URLs for full-text analysis' }, 'plan_status': { 'current_phase': 'Ready to extract individual article URLs', 'target': '23 Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'next_step': 'Access browsing pages and extract individual articles' } } with open(target_urls_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(target_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Target URLs saved to: {os.path.basename(target_urls_file)}") print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR ARTICLE EXTRACTION PHASE:") print(f"We have successfully identified {len(target_urls_for_extraction)} high-priority") print(f"browsing URLs that contain Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds.") print(f"The next step is to access these pages and extract individual article URLs") print(f"to complete the PLAN requirement of analyzing full-text content.") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No suitable target URLs identified for extraction") print(f"The priority URLs may not contain the expected 2012 article listings") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No priority browsing URLs found in the analysis file") print(f"May need to re-run the analysis to identify browsing pages") else: print(f"‚ùå No final analysis files found") print(f"Available analysis files: {analysis_files}") print(f"Need to run the article analysis step first")

Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time # First, let's inspect the target URLs file to understand what we need to access print("Inspecting target browsing URLs file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the target URLs file target_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if 'target_browsing_urls_for_extraction' in f] if not target_files: print("‚ùå No target browsing URLs file found") else: latest_target_file = sorted(target_files)[-1] target_path = f'workspace/{latest_target_file}' print(f"üìÑ Inspecting file: {latest_target_file}") # First inspect the file structure safely try: with open(target_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: file_content = f.read() print(f"‚úÖ File loaded successfully, size: {len(file_content)} characters") # Parse JSON and inspect structure target_data = json.loads(file_content) print(f"‚úÖ JSON parsed successfully") print(f"\nüìã File structure:") for key, value in target_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error inspecting file: {e}") target_data = None if target_data: # Extract the target URLs for accessing target_urls = target_data.get('target_urls', []) print(f"\nüéØ Target URLs found: {len(target_urls)}") if target_urls: print(f"\nüìã TARGET URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {url_info.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {url_info.get('url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Priority: {url_info.get('priority', 'No priority')}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ACCESSING BROWSING PAGES TO EXTRACT INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) individual_articles = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}/{len(target_urls)}: {url_info.get('title', 'Unknown')}") url = url_info.get('url', '') print(f"URL: {url}") print("-" * 60) try: # Add realistic browser headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', 'Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', 'Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', 'Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none' } # Make request with proper timeout response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"üìÑ Page content length: {len(response.text)} characters") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for Scientific Reports article links # Pattern 1: /articles/srep##### (old format) # Pattern 2: /articles/s41598-###-##### (new format) article_links = set() # Use set to avoid duplicates # Find all links on the page all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"üîç Found {len(all_links)} total links on page") # Filter for Scientific Reports article patterns for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') # Check for Scientific Reports article patterns if ('/articles/srep' in href or '/articles/s41598' in href): # Convert relative URLs to absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = 'https://www.nature.com' + href else: full_url = href # Extract article title from link text or nearby elements link_text = link.get_text(strip=True) article_title = link_text if link_text and len(link_text) > 10 else 'Title to be extracted from article page' article_links.add((full_url, article_title)) # Convert set back to list of dictionaries page_articles = [] for url_title_pair in article_links: page_articles.append({ 'url': url_title_pair[0], 'title': url_title_pair[1], 'source_page': url_info.get('title', 'Unknown source'), 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print(f"üìÑ Found {len(page_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles") # Show first few articles found for j, article in enumerate(page_articles[:5], 1): print(f" {j}. {article['title'][:70]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") if len(page_articles) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(page_articles) - 5} more articles") # Add to our collection individual_articles.extend(page_articles) else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access page (Status: {response.status_code})") if response.status_code == 403: print(" Possible anti-bot protection detected") elif response.status_code == 404: print(" Page not found - URL may be outdated") except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(f"‚ùå Request timeout after 30 seconds") except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(f"‚ùå Connection error - unable to reach server") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing page: {str(e)}") # Respectful delay between requests if i < len(target_urls): print(f"‚è±Ô∏è Waiting 3 seconds before next request...") time.sleep(3) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) # Remove any duplicates based on URL unique_articles = {} for article in individual_articles: url = article['url'] if url not in unique_articles: unique_articles[url] = article final_articles = list(unique_articles.values()) print(f"\nüìä EXTRACTION SUMMARY:") print(f"- Browsing pages accessed: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"- Total articles found: {len(individual_articles)}") print(f"- Unique articles after deduplication: {len(final_articles)}") if final_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ INDIVIDUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-" * 60) for i, article in enumerate(final_articles[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i:2d}. {article['title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Source: {article['source_page']}") if len(final_articles) > 10: print(f"\n ... and {len(final_articles) - 10} more articles") # Save the extracted individual articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/extracted_scientific_reports_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'extraction_method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'source_file': latest_target_file, 'browsing_pages_accessed': len(target_urls), 'total_articles_extracted': len(final_articles), 'target_urls_accessed': target_urls, 'extracted_articles': final_articles, 'plan_progress': { 'phase': 'Individual articles extracted', 'target': '23+ Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'articles_found': len(final_articles), 'next_step': 'Access full-text content to extract nano-compound names', 'ready_for_content_analysis': len(final_articles) > 0 } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Extracted articles saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN STATUS UPDATE:") print(f"‚úÖ Successfully extracted {len(final_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles") print(f"üîÑ Next phase: Access full-text content of each article to extract nano-compound names") print(f"üìã Target: Identify specific nano-compounds from abstracts, methodology, and results sections") if len(final_articles) >= 10: print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NANO-COMPOUND EXTRACTION PHASE:") print(f"We have sufficient individual articles to analyze for nano-compound identification.") print(f"The next step is to access the full-text content of these articles and extract") print(f"specific nano-compound names to complete the PLAN requirements.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED ARTICLES EXTRACTED:") print(f"Found {len(final_articles)} articles, which may be sufficient but fewer than expected.") print(f"Consider accessing additional browsing pages if more articles are needed.") else: print(f"\n‚ùå NO INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTED") print(f"The browsing pages did not contain extractable article links.") print(f"\nPossible issues:") print(f"- Pages may require JavaScript to load article listings") print(f"- Article links may use different URL patterns than expected") print(f"- Anti-scraping measures may be blocking content access") print(f"- URLs may be outdated or redirect to different pages") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Try using Selenium for JavaScript-rendered content") print(f"2. Access Nature.com search API directly if available") print(f"3. Try different URL patterns or search parameters") print(f"4. Use alternative academic databases for 2012 Scientific Reports articles") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No target URLs found in the data file") else: print(f"‚ùå Could not load target URLs data")

URL: https://www.nature.com/articles/srep00778 ... and 15 more articles ================================================================================ INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTION RESULTS ================================================================================ üìä EXTRACTION SUMMARY: - Browsing pages accessed: 2 - Total articles found: 40 - Unique articles after deduplication: 40 üìÑ INDIVIDUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND: ------------------------------------------------------------ 1. Centenarians, but not octogenarians, up-regulate the expression of microRNAs... URL: https://www.nature.com/articles/srep00961 Source: Articles in 2012 | Scientific Reports 2. Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the browsing page access phase to extract individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles. The code successfully accessed 2 high-priority browsing URLs from the target file and extracted 40 individual Scientific Reports articles with proper URLs (nature.com/articles/srep#####). The output shows successful web scraping with 20 articles found from each browsing page, proper deduplication, and comprehensive data saved to 'extracted_scientific_reports_articles_20250806_170641.json'. **PLAN** alignment: 95% complete - we now have individual Scientific Reports 2012 articles ready for nano-compound analysis. The extraction successfully identified articles with titles containing nano-related terms like 'nano-engineered carbon films', 'nanohole optical trapping', and other nano-compound references. The code properly prepared for the final phase by saving article URLs, titles, and metadata needed to access full-text content. Next step clearly defined: access the full-text content of these 40 individual articles to extract specific nano-compound names from abstracts, methodology, and results sections to complete the PLAN requirement of identifying the target nano-compound mentioned in the TASK. The substantial output should be saved to workspace as 'extracted_articles_summary.txt' for future reference given its comprehensive nature and importance to the nano-compound identification process.
Python Code python
import os import requests import json from datetime import datetime from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time # First, let's inspect the target URLs file to understand what we need to access print("Inspecting target browsing URLs file structure...") print("=" * 80) # Find the target URLs file target_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if 'target_browsing_urls_for_extraction' in f] if not target_files: print("‚ùå No target browsing URLs file found") else: latest_target_file = sorted(target_files)[-1] target_path = f'workspace/{latest_target_file}' print(f"üìÑ Inspecting file: {latest_target_file}") # First inspect the file structure safely try: with open(target_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: file_content = f.read() print(f"‚úÖ File loaded successfully, size: {len(file_content)} characters") # Parse JSON and inspect structure target_data = json.loads(file_content) print(f"‚úÖ JSON parsed successfully") print(f"\nüìã File structure:") for key, value in target_data.items(): if isinstance(value, list): print(f" - {key}: list with {len(value)} items") elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f" - {key}: dict with {len(value)} keys") else: print(f" - {key}: {type(value).__name__} - {str(value)[:50]}...") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error inspecting file: {e}") target_data = None if target_data: # Extract the target URLs for accessing target_urls = target_data.get('target_urls', []) print(f"\nüéØ Target URLs found: {len(target_urls)}") if target_urls: print(f"\nüìã TARGET URLS TO ACCESS:") for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\n{i}. {url_info.get('title', 'No title')}") print(f" URL: {url_info.get('url', 'No URL')}") print(f" Priority: {url_info.get('priority', 'No priority')}") print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"ACCESSING BROWSING PAGES TO EXTRACT INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES") print(f"=" * 80) individual_articles = [] for i, url_info in enumerate(target_urls, 1): print(f"\nAccessing {i}/{len(target_urls)}: {url_info.get('title', 'Unknown')}") url = url_info.get('url', '') print(f"URL: {url}") print("-" * 60) try: # Add realistic browser headers headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,image/apng,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1', 'Sec-Fetch-Dest': 'document', 'Sec-Fetch-Mode': 'navigate', 'Sec-Fetch-Site': 'none' } # Make request with proper timeout response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed page (Status: {response.status_code})") print(f"üìÑ Page content length: {len(response.text)} characters") # Parse HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for Scientific Reports article links # Pattern 1: /articles/srep##### (old format) # Pattern 2: /articles/s41598-###-##### (new format) article_links = set() # Use set to avoid duplicates # Find all links on the page all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f"üîç Found {len(all_links)} total links on page") # Filter for Scientific Reports article patterns for link in all_links: href = link.get('href', '') # Check for Scientific Reports article patterns if ('/articles/srep' in href or '/articles/s41598' in href): # Convert relative URLs to absolute if href.startswith('/'): full_url = 'https://www.nature.com' + href else: full_url = href # Extract article title from link text or nearby elements link_text = link.get_text(strip=True) article_title = link_text if link_text and len(link_text) > 10 else 'Title to be extracted from article page' article_links.add((full_url, article_title)) # Convert set back to list of dictionaries page_articles = [] for url_title_pair in article_links: page_articles.append({ 'url': url_title_pair[0], 'title': url_title_pair[1], 'source_page': url_info.get('title', 'Unknown source'), 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat() }) print(f"üìÑ Found {len(page_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles") # Show first few articles found for j, article in enumerate(page_articles[:5], 1): print(f" {j}. {article['title'][:70]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") if len(page_articles) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(page_articles) - 5} more articles") # Add to our collection individual_articles.extend(page_articles) else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access page (Status: {response.status_code})") if response.status_code == 403: print(" Possible anti-bot protection detected") elif response.status_code == 404: print(" Page not found - URL may be outdated") except requests.exceptions.Timeout: print(f"‚ùå Request timeout after 30 seconds") except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError: print(f"‚ùå Connection error - unable to reach server") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing page: {str(e)}") # Respectful delay between requests if i < len(target_urls): print(f"‚è±Ô∏è Waiting 3 seconds before next request...") time.sleep(3) print(f"\n" + "=" * 80) print(f"INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTION RESULTS") print(f"=" * 80) # Remove any duplicates based on URL unique_articles = {} for article in individual_articles: url = article['url'] if url not in unique_articles: unique_articles[url] = article final_articles = list(unique_articles.values()) print(f"\nüìä EXTRACTION SUMMARY:") print(f"- Browsing pages accessed: {len(target_urls)}") print(f"- Total articles found: {len(individual_articles)}") print(f"- Unique articles after deduplication: {len(final_articles)}") if final_articles: print(f"\nüìÑ INDIVIDUAL SCIENTIFIC REPORTS 2012 ARTICLES FOUND:") print("-" * 60) for i, article in enumerate(final_articles[:10], 1): print(f"\n{i:2d}. {article['title'][:80]}...") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Source: {article['source_page']}") if len(final_articles) > 10: print(f"\n ... and {len(final_articles) - 10} more articles") # Save the extracted individual articles timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") articles_file = f'workspace/extracted_scientific_reports_articles_{timestamp}.json' articles_data = { 'extraction_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'extraction_method': 'Web scraping of Nature.com browsing pages', 'source_file': latest_target_file, 'browsing_pages_accessed': len(target_urls), 'total_articles_extracted': len(final_articles), 'target_urls_accessed': target_urls, 'extracted_articles': final_articles, 'plan_progress': { 'phase': 'Individual articles extracted', 'target': '23+ Scientific Reports 2012 articles studying nano-compounds', 'articles_found': len(final_articles), 'next_step': 'Access full-text content to extract nano-compound names', 'ready_for_content_analysis': len(final_articles) > 0 } } with open(articles_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(articles_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nüíæ Extracted articles saved to: {os.path.basename(articles_file)}") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN STATUS UPDATE:") print(f"‚úÖ Successfully extracted {len(final_articles)} individual Scientific Reports articles") print(f"üîÑ Next phase: Access full-text content of each article to extract nano-compound names") print(f"üìã Target: Identify specific nano-compounds from abstracts, methodology, and results sections") if len(final_articles) >= 10: print(f"\nüöÄ READY FOR NANO-COMPOUND EXTRACTION PHASE:") print(f"We have sufficient individual articles to analyze for nano-compound identification.") print(f"The next step is to access the full-text content of these articles and extract") print(f"specific nano-compound names to complete the PLAN requirements.") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED ARTICLES EXTRACTED:") print(f"Found {len(final_articles)} articles, which may be sufficient but fewer than expected.") print(f"Consider accessing additional browsing pages if more articles are needed.") else: print(f"\n‚ùå NO INDIVIDUAL ARTICLES EXTRACTED") print(f"The browsing pages did not contain extractable article links.") print(f"\nPossible issues:") print(f"- Pages may require JavaScript to load article listings") print(f"- Article links may use different URL patterns than expected") print(f"- Anti-scraping measures may be blocking content access") print(f"- URLs may be outdated or redirect to different pages") print(f"\nüí° ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:") print(f"1. Try using Selenium for JavaScript-rendered content") print(f"2. Access Nature.com search API directly if available") print(f"3. Try different URL patterns or search parameters") print(f"4. Use alternative academic databases for 2012 Scientific Reports articles") else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No target URLs found in the data file") else: print(f"‚ùå Could not load target URLs data")
