tester
2025-08-06 17:31:18
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the **PLAN** requirements. The script successfully analyzed all 4 Scientific Reports 2012 conference proceedings articles, correctly excluded Articles 1 and 4 (containing 'plasmonic' terms), and accessed the full content of candidate Articles 2 and 3. Article 2 ('Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots') was identified as the qualifying article that studies nano-compounds (nanocrystals, quantum dots) while containing no plasmon/plasmonic mentions. Article 3 was excluded due to containing plasmon mentions in its full content despite having 'nanotips' in the title. The analysis successfully extracted the specific nano-compound name: 'NANOCRYSTAL' (the most frequently mentioned nano-compound). **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete - the task has been fully accomplished. The analysis results and individual article content files have been saved to workspace for documentation. No further development is needed.
Python Code python
import json import os import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time # Find the correct workspace directory and article links file links_file = None workspace_dir = None for item in os.listdir('.'): if item.startswith('workspace') and os.path.isdir(item): potential_file = os.path.join(item, 'scientific_reports_2012_article_links.json') if os.path.exists(potential_file): links_file = potential_file workspace_dir = item break if links_file: print(f"Found article links file: {links_file}") print("Loading article data and analyzing for nano-compounds...") print("="*80) # Load the article links data with open(links_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) articles = data['article_links'] print(f"Analyzing {len(articles)} Scientific Reports 2012 conference proceedings articles:") # Categorize articles based on titles candidate_articles = [] excluded_articles = [] for i, article in enumerate(articles, 1): url = article.get('url', '') title_text = article.get('text', '') print(f"\n{i}. Article {i}:") print(f" URL: {url}") print(f" Title: {title_text}") # Check for plasmon/plasmonic terms in title title_lower = title_text.lower() has_plasmon = 'plasmon' in title_lower or 'plasmonic' in title_lower print(f" Contains plasmon/plasmonic in title: {'YES' if has_plasmon else 'NO'}") # Check for nano-related terms in title - FIXED: Define nano_terms first, then use title_lower nano_terms = ['nano', 'nanoscale', 'nanotip', 'nanoparticle', 'nanostructure', 'nanometer'] has_nano = False for term in nano_terms: if term in title_lower: has_nano = True break print(f" Contains nano-related terms in title: {'YES' if has_nano else 'NO'}") if has_plasmon: excluded_articles.append({ 'article_num': i, 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'exclusion_reason': 'Contains plasmon/plasmonic terms' }) print(f" ‚ùå EXCLUDED: Contains plasmon/plasmonic terms") else: candidate_articles.append({ 'article_num': i, 'url': url, 'title': title_text, 'has_nano_in_title': has_nano }) print(f" ‚úÖ CANDIDATE: No plasmon/plasmonic terms detected") print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"INITIAL FILTERING RESULTS:") print(f"- Excluded articles: {len(excluded_articles)}") print(f"- Candidate articles: {len(candidate_articles)}") for excluded in excluded_articles: print(f" ‚ùå Article {excluded['article_num']}: {excluded['title'][:60]}... - {excluded['exclusion_reason']}") for candidate in candidate_articles: print(f" ‚úÖ Article {candidate['article_num']}: {candidate['title'][:60]}...") print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"ACCESSING FULL CONTENT OF CANDIDATE ARTICLES") print(f"="*80) # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } article_analyses = [] for candidate in candidate_articles: article_num = candidate['article_num'] url = candidate['url'] title = candidate['title'] print(f"\nAnalyzing Article {article_num}: {title}") print(f"URL: {url}") print("-"*60) try: # Access the full article content response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed article {article_num}") # Parse the HTML content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract the main article text content content_selectors = [ 'div[data-test="article-body"]', '.c-article-body', '#article-content', '.article-content', 'main', '.main-content' ] article_text = "" for selector in content_selectors: content_elements = soup.select(selector) if content_elements: article_text = ' '.join([elem.get_text() for elem in content_elements]) break # If no specific content found, get all text if not article_text: article_text = soup.get_text() print(f" Extracted text length: {len(article_text)} characters") # Convert to lowercase for analysis article_text_lower = article_text.lower() # Check for plasmon/plasmonic terms in full content plasmon_terms = ['plasmon', 'plasmonic', 'plasmons'] plasmon_mentions = [] for term in plasmon_terms: if term in article_text_lower: count = article_text_lower.count(term) plasmon_mentions.append(f"{term}: {count}") has_plasmon_content = len(plasmon_mentions) > 0 print(f" Contains plasmon/plasmonic in content: {'YES' if has_plasmon_content else 'NO'}") if plasmon_mentions: print(f" Plasmon mentions: {', '.join(plasmon_mentions)}") # Check for nano-compound terms in full content nano_compound_terms = [ 'nanoparticle', 'nanoparticles', 'nano-particle', 'nano-particles', 'nanocrystal', 'nanocrystals', 'nano-crystal', 'nano-crystals', 'nanowire', 'nanowires', 'nano-wire', 'nano-wires', 'nanotube', 'nanotubes', 'nano-tube', 'nano-tubes', 'nanorod', 'nanorods', 'nano-rod', 'nano-rods', 'nanodot', 'nanodots', 'nano-dot', 'nano-dots', 'quantum dot', 'quantum dots', 'nanocomposite', 'nanocomposites', 'nano-composite', 'nano-composites', 'nanostructure', 'nanostructures', 'nano-structure', 'nano-structures', 'nanotip', 'nanotips', 'nano-tip', 'nano-tips', 'nanofiber', 'nanofibers', 'nano-fiber', 'nano-fibers', 'nanomaterial', 'nanomaterials', 'nano-material', 'nano-materials' ] nano_mentions = [] for term in nano_compound_terms: if term in article_text_lower: count = article_text_lower.count(term) nano_mentions.append(f"{term}: {count}") has_nano_compounds = len(nano_mentions) > 0 print(f" Contains nano-compound terms: {'YES' if has_nano_compounds else 'NO'}") if nano_mentions: print(f" Nano-compound mentions: {', '.join(nano_mentions[:10])}{' ...' if len(nano_mentions) > 10 else ''}") # Determine if this article meets criteria meets_criteria = has_nano_compounds and not has_plasmon_content print(f" üéØ MEETS CRITERIA (nano-compounds + no plasmons): {'YES' if meets_criteria else 'NO'}") # If this article meets criteria, extract specific nano-compound names specific_nano_compounds = [] if meets_criteria: print(f"\n üîç EXTRACTING SPECIFIC NANO-COMPOUND NAMES:") # Look for specific compound names in the text compound_patterns = [ 'silicon nanowires', 'gold nanoparticles', 'carbon nanotubes', 'silver nanoparticles', 'zinc oxide nanoparticles', 'titanium dioxide nanoparticles', 'quantum dots', 'cdse quantum dots', 'gaas nanowires', 'inp nanowires', 'metallic nanotips', 'silicon nanotips', 'tungsten nanotips' ] for compound in compound_patterns: if compound in article_text_lower: count = article_text_lower.count(compound) specific_nano_compounds.append(f"{compound}: {count}") print(f" - {compound}: mentioned {count} times") # Also look for context around nano-compound mentions import re nano_contexts = [] for term in ['nanotip', 'nanotips']: if term in article_text_lower: # Find sentences containing the term sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]+', article_text) for sentence in sentences: if term in sentence.lower(): nano_contexts.append(sentence.strip()[:200]) if nano_contexts: print(f"\n üìù CONTEXT EXAMPLES:") for i, context in enumerate(nano_contexts[:3], 1): print(f" {i}. {context}...") # Save the analysis analysis = { 'article_number': article_num, 'url': url, 'title': title, 'content_length': len(article_text), 'has_plasmon_content': has_plasmon_content, 'plasmon_mentions': plasmon_mentions, 'has_nano_compounds': has_nano_compounds, 'nano_mentions': nano_mentions, 'specific_nano_compounds': specific_nano_compounds, 'meets_criteria': meets_criteria, 'full_text_sample': article_text[:1500] # First 1500 characters for reference } article_analyses.append(analysis) # Save individual article content for detailed analysis if needed article_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, f'article_{article_num}_content.txt') with open(article_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(f"Article {article_num}: {title}\n") f.write(f"URL: {url}\n") f.write("="*80 + "\n") f.write(article_text) print(f" Full content saved to: {article_file}") else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access article {article_num}. Status code: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing article {article_num}: {str(e)}") # Add delay between requests to be respectful time.sleep(2) print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS") print(f"="*80) # Find articles that meet the criteria qualifying_articles = [analysis for analysis in article_analyses if analysis['meets_criteria']] print(f"Articles that meet criteria (nano-compounds + no plasmons): {len(qualifying_articles)}") if qualifying_articles: for article in qualifying_articles: print(f"\nüéØ QUALIFYING ARTICLE FOUND:") print(f" Article {article['article_number']}: {article['title']}") print(f" URL: {article['url']}") print(f" Nano-compound mentions: {len(article['nano_mentions'])}") print(f" Plasmon mentions: {len(article['plasmon_mentions'])}") print(f" Specific nano-compounds identified: {len(article['specific_nano_compounds'])}") if article['specific_nano_compounds']: print(f" üî¨ SPECIFIC NANO-COMPOUNDS:") for compound in article['specific_nano_compounds']: print(f" - {compound}") # Extract the most prominent nano-compound name if article['nano_mentions']: most_mentioned = max(article['nano_mentions'], key=lambda x: int(x.split(': ')[1])) compound_name = most_mentioned.split(': ')[0] print(f"\n ‚≠ê PRIMARY NANO-COMPOUND: {compound_name.upper()}") else: print("\n‚ùå No articles found that meet the criteria (nano-compounds without plasmon/plasmonic mentions)") # Save complete analysis results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'nano_compound_analysis_results.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'total_articles_analyzed': len(articles), 'excluded_articles': excluded_articles, 'candidate_articles_analyzed': len(candidate_articles), 'qualifying_articles_count': len(qualifying_articles), 'detailed_analyses': article_analyses, 'qualifying_articles': qualifying_articles }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\nComplete analysis results saved to: {results_file}") else: print("‚ùå Article links file not found. Please run the previous step first.")
Execution Output

Code Execution - Plan #5 (Iteration 7)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import json import os # First, let's inspect the analysis results file to understand its structure results_file = None workspace_dir = None # Find the workspace directory and results file for item in os.listdir('.'): if item.startswith('workspace') and os.path.isdir(item): potential_file = os.path.join(item, 'nano_compound_analysis_results.json') if os.path.exists(potential_file): results_file = potential_file workspace_dir = item break if results_file: print(f"Found analysis results file: {results_file}") print("Inspecting file structure first...") print("=" * 80) # Load and inspect the file structure with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print("File structure overview:") print(f"- Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"- Analysis timestamp: {data.get('analysis_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {data.get('total_articles_analyzed', 'N/A')}") print(f"- Qualifying articles count: {data.get('qualifying_articles_count', 'N/A')}") if 'qualifying_articles' in data and len(data['qualifying_articles']) > 0: print(f"- Qualifying articles structure: {list(data['qualifying_articles'][0].keys())}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DETAILED ANALYSIS OF QUALIFYING ARTICLE") print("=" * 80) # Extract details about the qualifying article if data.get('qualifying_articles'): qualifying_article = data['qualifying_articles'][0] # Should be only one print(f"\nüìä QUALIFYING ARTICLE DETAILS:") print(f" Article Number: {qualifying_article['article_number']}") print(f" Title: {qualifying_article['title']}") print(f" URL: {qualifying_article['url']}") print(f" Content Length: {qualifying_article['content_length']} characters") print(f" Has Plasmon Content: {qualifying_article['has_plasmon_content']}") print(f" Has Nano Compounds: {qualifying_article['has_nano_compounds']}") print(f" Meets Criteria: {qualifying_article['meets_criteria']}") print(f"\nüî¨ NANO-COMPOUND ANALYSIS:") nano_mentions = qualifying_article.get('nano_mentions', []) print(f" Total nano-compound mentions: {len(nano_mentions)}") if nano_mentions: print(f" All nano-compound mentions:") for mention in nano_mentions: print(f" - {mention}") # Find the most frequently mentioned nano-compound max_count = 0 primary_compound = "" for mention in nano_mentions: compound, count_str = mention.split(': ') count = int(count_str) if count > max_count: max_count = count primary_compound = compound print(f"\n üéØ PRIMARY NANO-COMPOUND (most mentioned): {primary_compound.upper()}") print(f" üéØ MENTION COUNT: {max_count}") # Check specific nano-compounds identified specific_compounds = qualifying_article.get('specific_nano_compounds', []) if specific_compounds: print(f"\nüîç SPECIFIC NANO-COMPOUNDS IDENTIFIED:") for compound in specific_compounds: print(f" - {compound}") # Show a sample of the article content for context content_sample = qualifying_article.get('full_text_sample', '') if content_sample: print(f"\nüìù ARTICLE CONTENT SAMPLE (first 500 characters):") print(f" {content_sample[:500]}...") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("TASK COMPLETION SUMMARY") print("=" * 80) excluded_count = len(data.get('excluded_articles', [])) candidate_count = data.get('candidate_articles_analyzed', 0) qualifying_count = data.get('qualifying_articles_count', 0) print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Total articles from Scientific Reports 2012: {data.get('total_articles_analyzed', 0)}") print(f" Articles excluded (contain plasmon/plasmonic): {excluded_count}") print(f" Candidate articles analyzed: {candidate_count}") print(f" Articles meeting criteria (nano-compounds, no plasmons): {qualifying_count}") if qualifying_count == 1: qualifying_article = data['qualifying_articles'][0] nano_mentions = qualifying_article.get('nano_mentions', []) if nano_mentions: # Extract the primary nano-compound name max_count = 0 primary_compound = "" for mention in nano_mentions: compound, count_str = mention.split(': ') count = int(count_str) if count > max_count: max_count = count primary_compound = compound print(f"\n‚úÖ TASK COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER:") print(f" Article: {qualifying_article['title']}") print(f" Primary nano-compound studied: {primary_compound.upper()}") print(f" Verification: Contains {max_count} mentions of '{primary_compound}' and NO plasmon/plasmonic references") else: print(f"\n‚ùå ERROR: No nano-compound mentions found in qualifying article") elif qualifying_count == 0: print(f"\n‚ùå ERROR: No articles found that meet the criteria") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Multiple articles found that meet criteria ({qualifying_count})") else: print("‚ùå Analysis results file not found.") print("Available files in current directory:") for item in os.listdir('.'): if os.path.isdir(item) and item.startswith('workspace'): print(f" üìÅ {item}/") workspace_files = os.listdir(item) for file in workspace_files: print(f" üìÑ {file}")
Execution Output

Even though the PhC is structurally imperfect, the existence of leaky modes, determined both theoretically and experimentally in the broad spectral region, implies that an efficient light interaction with a material periodicity occurs in the sample. Python Code python
import json import os # First, let's inspect the analysis results file to understand its structure results_file = None workspace_dir = None # Find the workspace directory and results file for item in os.listdir('.'): if item.startswith('workspace') and os.path.isdir(item): potential_file = os.path.join(item, 'nano_compound_analysis_results.json') if os.path.exists(potential_file): results_file = potential_file workspace_dir = item break if results_file: print(f"Found analysis results file: {results_file}") print("Inspecting file structure first...") print("=" * 80) # Load and inspect the file structure with open(results_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print("File structure overview:") print(f"- Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}") print(f"- Analysis timestamp: {data.get('analysis_timestamp', 'N/A')}") print(f"- Total articles analyzed: {data.get('total_articles_analyzed', 'N/A')}") print(f"- Qualifying articles count: {data.get('qualifying_articles_count', 'N/A')}") if 'qualifying_articles' in data and len(data['qualifying_articles']) > 0: print(f"- Qualifying articles structure: {list(data['qualifying_articles'][0].keys())}") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("DETAILED ANALYSIS OF QUALIFYING ARTICLE") print("=" * 80) # Extract details about the qualifying article if data.get('qualifying_articles'): qualifying_article = data['qualifying_articles'][0] # Should be only one print(f"\nüìä QUALIFYING ARTICLE DETAILS:") print(f" Article Number: {qualifying_article['article_number']}") print(f" Title: {qualifying_article['title']}") print(f" URL: {qualifying_article['url']}") print(f" Content Length: {qualifying_article['content_length']} characters") print(f" Has Plasmon Content: {qualifying_article['has_plasmon_content']}") print(f" Has Nano Compounds: {qualifying_article['has_nano_compounds']}") print(f" Meets Criteria: {qualifying_article['meets_criteria']}") print(f"\nüî¨ NANO-COMPOUND ANALYSIS:") nano_mentions = qualifying_article.get('nano_mentions', []) print(f" Total nano-compound mentions: {len(nano_mentions)}") if nano_mentions: print(f" All nano-compound mentions:") for mention in nano_mentions: print(f" - {mention}") # Find the most frequently mentioned nano-compound max_count = 0 primary_compound = "" for mention in nano_mentions: compound, count_str = mention.split(': ') count = int(count_str) if count > max_count: max_count = count primary_compound = compound print(f"\n üéØ PRIMARY NANO-COMPOUND (most mentioned): {primary_compound.upper()}") print(f" üéØ MENTION COUNT: {max_count}") # Check specific nano-compounds identified specific_compounds = qualifying_article.get('specific_nano_compounds', []) if specific_compounds: print(f"\nüîç SPECIFIC NANO-COMPOUNDS IDENTIFIED:") for compound in specific_compounds: print(f" - {compound}") # Show a sample of the article content for context content_sample = qualifying_article.get('full_text_sample', '') if content_sample: print(f"\nüìù ARTICLE CONTENT SAMPLE (first 500 characters):") print(f" {content_sample[:500]}...") print("\n" + "=" * 80) print("TASK COMPLETION SUMMARY") print("=" * 80) excluded_count = len(data.get('excluded_articles', [])) candidate_count = data.get('candidate_articles_analyzed', 0) qualifying_count = data.get('qualifying_articles_count', 0) print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Total articles from Scientific Reports 2012: {data.get('total_articles_analyzed', 0)}") print(f" Articles excluded (contain plasmon/plasmonic): {excluded_count}") print(f" Candidate articles analyzed: {candidate_count}") print(f" Articles meeting criteria (nano-compounds, no plasmons): {qualifying_count}") if qualifying_count == 1: qualifying_article = data['qualifying_articles'][0] nano_mentions = qualifying_article.get('nano_mentions', []) if nano_mentions: # Extract the primary nano-compound name max_count = 0 primary_compound = "" for mention in nano_mentions: compound, count_str = mention.split(': ') count = int(count_str) if count > max_count: max_count = count primary_compound = compound print(f"\n‚úÖ TASK COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY!") print(f"\nüéØ FINAL ANSWER:") print(f" Article: {qualifying_article['title']}") print(f" Primary nano-compound studied: {primary_compound.upper()}") print(f" Verification: Contains {max_count} mentions of '{primary_compound}' and NO plasmon/plasmonic references") else: print(f"\n‚ùå ERROR: No nano-compound mentions found in qualifying article") elif qualifying_count == 0: print(f"\n‚ùå ERROR: No articles found that meet the criteria") else: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Multiple articles found that meet criteria ({qualifying_count})") else: print("‚ùå Analysis results file not found.") print("Available files in current directory:") for item in os.listdir('.'): if os.path.isdir(item) and item.startswith('workspace'): print(f" üìÅ {item}/") workspace_files = os.listdir(item) for file in workspace_files: print(f" üìÑ {file}")
